Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: E M
Reviews.Content: I am sure like most people who pay for a resort do so expecting impecable service and spotless housekeeping. This is not what you will find here..at least that was my experience. On the first night when I went to get into bed I noticed a strong urine smell and when I pulled the covers back further to investigate there was a pubic hair on the bed frame. There was also no matress pad yet there were pads, like you would expect on the beds, in the other room. Not to mention the fact that the sheets and towels are the quality of a motel, seriously. Rough feeling and not at all considered luxury. When someone came to change out as much as they could late at night I went to sit on the couch and almost sat on someone's fingernail clipping! They came the next morning and pulled up the rug around the bed and the smell was gone. Then the next morning I woke up and went to the kitchen and almost stepped on a dying roach and some kind of worm in the hallway. Went to get scissors and knife and they were dirty. Went to use the flashlight and it didn't work. The next morning I had to use the plunger because the toilet stopped up and almost vomited because when I pulled out the plunger it had been sitting in poop water for who knows how long and there was a dead roach in there. After leaving 2 messages in 2 days for the GM I finally got him by accident when I was calling the concierge and he said he hadn't received my messages. He did end up taking off a night of the $1400 a night we were paying for the quality we weren't getting. I was paranoid to sleep or sit on anything. There were supposed to be beach attendants but they were rarely there and when they were they acted like you were bothering them to ask for anything. There was also broken plastic that I am guessing is from their cheap plastic chairs and cig butts in the sand around the cottage porch. Zina, a concierge was horrible to deal with. In fact I dreaded anytime I needed she answered because she acted like you were bothering her. She failed to tell our party to be looking for a smaller ferry(different from what we had used all week) and when I went in to ask about it she was a horrible witch to not only me but one of the restaurant employees who tried to help.Then after we were already running late we didn't end up having a cab waiting for us. I would strongly suggest to spend your money elsewhere at a place that is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “amazing, worth every penny!!!”
Reviews.Author: jessygirl22687
Reviews.Content: this is the perfect place to stay at in key west. it's a private island, you need to take a ferry to get to it. very quick ride, 5-10 minutes. the cottages are beautiful, private, and clean. beds are extremely comfortable!! prompt room service, good food. i would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EVERYTHING!!”
Reviews.Author: Bradley M
Reviews.Content: SUNSET KEY!! Besides getting "mangled" before and after dinner I will say that the food was pretty damn good!! The service was outstanding, and the view was unreal!! Went with a group of 15 or so and we ate to hearts content. Boat ride over was enjoyable . All around one of the best restaurants I have ever been too.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top!”
Reviews.Author: Mark F
Reviews.Content: While staying at the Westin Key West we used the beach, spa and food services of this property. Our three day experience was nothing less than 5 STAR. The staff are very well trained and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Stressful Stay In Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: Bostonstory
Reviews.Content: First let me say that this is a beautifully maintained resort with picture perfect cottages, manicured grounds, swaying palm trees and a lovely zero entry pool. Sunset Key has one restaurant, Latitudes, and it is set right on the beach. At night with white table cloths, lit tiki torches and gas light fixtures it is a romantic location for dinner. Latitudes services a beach bar at the pool and you can order food either at the pool or on the beach. The restaurant has food runners - the pool bar isn't a separate facility - but Marcus will take good care of you by the pool. The food is fantastic and the restaurant is worth a visit for its lovely atmosphere even if you aren't staying as a guest at the resort. Sunset Key's sister resort, the Westin on Front Street has several other dining options, but note that you need to take a short ferry ride to get back to its location on Mallory Dock. Sunset Key has limited options on site. It is basically the cottages, the one restaurant, the one pool, and a tennis court. On the other side of the island there are private houses where the owners tool around in golf carts. My advice if you chose to stay is to consider it more like renting a condo in a lovely tropical location rather than staying at a full service resort and that way you won't be disappointed. The concierge service, bell service, room service are all unreliable. More often than not, you receive voice mail when you call the front desk. There is generally one person doing double duty as receptionist, bell man, and concierge and that accounts for the unavailability. Here are some tips if you stay at the resort: 1. There is no service before 7:00 a.m. No one answers the phones. There is no coffee service in the morning. You make your own or there is breakfast at 7:00 in the restaurant. I called shortly after 7:00 with a request for more coffee packets and I was told "We don't open until 7:00." Seriously? I said "It is after 7:00 and we would appreciate coffee," and she reluctantly agreed to have someone bring us coffee packets. If you don't want to get dressed and go to breakfast make sure there is enough coffee in your room. 2. There is no true concierge like you would find in a New York hotel or in a Four Seasons. Those individuals have built relationships and know how to fulfill requests. Sunset Key does not have a real concierge. We asked for bicycles and were told we would be met back at the dock on Key West. We arrived at the dock. No bikes. We walked to the front desk at the Westin on Front Street. The concierge there called the Sunset Key concierge and naturally received voice mail. With the frustrated concierge on Front Street unable to assist us, we had a nice walking tour of the island. We asked the Sunset Key front desk for a taxi to meet us on the Key West side to take us to the airport. No taxi. We queued up with everyone else in front of the Westin on Front Street. 3. There are no transfers between the airport and the Westin. We called before our trip and were told "Take a taxi." We weren't advised to check in at the Westin on Front Street (how would you know?) and they will take your luggage onto the small ferry boat that makes the short 10 minute trip from Mallory Dock to Sunset Key. We were not offered help with our luggage and we carried our own luggage from the dock onto and off the boat and all the way up the flight of stairs to our cottage. We could handle it, but it wasn't the service we expected. 4. The luggage transfer is unreliable. Stay with your luggage even if they have it on a rolling cart. In the confusion of arrivals and departures at the Westin on Front Street I watched as the bell man started rolling our luggage back in the direction of the Ferry. I stopped him in time, but we otherwise would have missed our flight. 5.Note that there is no grocery store, retail shop or pharmacy on the island. This gives the island a peaceful quality, but if you don't want to take the ferry back into town, bring whatever you need with you. 6. The resort has breakfast baskets with a few muffins and pieces of whole fruit (banana, apple) that they deliver around 8:00-8:30. We made a request to have it earlier, but they resisted the request and accommodated us for one day, and the next day it was back to 8:30. We prefer to have a hang out morning on vacation and not get dressed for the restaurant. When we realized the resort wouldn't accommodate our request we went to a small grocery store on Key West and bought a few items for breakfast. In summary, I would have given the resort five stars if it had decent service. I shrugged off the few negative reviews (even on the Westin's website) thinking they were just cranky. If you travel a lot for business or pleasure and stay at nice hotels, you are certain to be disappointed in the service at this resort. Adjust your expectations downwards, treat it like you are staying in a condo with a few amenities, enjoy the pool and the wonderful food and you will have a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: claudiasil
Reviews.Content: There are not enough words I can use to describe Sunset Key! My husband and I stayed there this weekend as a mini getaway to celebrate our anniversary. Being locals of South Florida we have traveled many times to the keys and have gotten to know the best and the worse of the florida Keys!! This is really one of the Best of the Florida Keys!!! The attention to detail and customer service at the Westin is unbelievable and that just multiples when staying at Sunset key. From the start Jennifer was incredible. Attentive and went out of her way to make sure we had an incredible stay. We arrived a little after 1:00 am and we had a ferry ready to go within minutes and a bellman waiting for us at the Key to take us to our cottage. The cottage was beautiful. Typical keys casual look with all the comforts of home but yet you always feel that you are staying a a luxury hotel. We stayed at the beach front cottage, Sand dollar; and to wake up in the morning with that view alone is priceless. Even though it is high season and they were fully booked you felt you were in a secluded island and did not see crowds or feel invaded of your privacy. All throughout we were completely in aww and we plan to come many more times in the future including with our children in the summer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money!”
Reviews.Author: Ken T
Reviews.Content: We were very concerned that this place would not be worth the very high cost. We were thrilled that it was all it was supposed to be! The cottage was beautiful and luxurious without being over the top. The setting was tropical and wonderful. The beach was great and the views were stunning. We had dinner at the restaurant, Latitudes, and watched the sunset. Really special. The service at the restaurant was outstanding and really made the dinner for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great peacefull resort!”
Reviews.Author: Romcollins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in early January. We absolutely loved the place. The resort on it's own Island about a 1/2 mile off Key West was fantastic! The shuttle to key west leaves every 1/2 hour and we went back and forth every morning and evening for sightseeing and then after returning to relax on the amazing beach (so peacefully), we then go back to town for dinner and drinks. We loved our stay ! It's pricey,but considering what the operating costs are on a place like this, it's priced accordingly. We will stay no where else, when we return to Key west!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this scam Sunset Key Westin property, crawling with ants!”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this Westin "resort." Turns out "Sunset Key" is not the real name, the real name is Tank Island, just to highlight what a facade this location is. These cottages were built on top of dredged up sea floor so that the massive cruise ships can come and dock between you and Duval Street, definitely not romantic. The Navy used this landfill for holding the oil tanks, hence the true name Tank Island. The few guests we spotted were geriatric and probably are not filling out the favorable reviews you read here, so I highly suspect all the glowing reviews are fake and invented by the marketing machine from the Westin. In fact, I am pretty sure the reservation manager spends his time filling out fake reviews rather than helping customers. We travel quite a bit to Europe, Caribbean islands, Hawaii over the last couple of years and generally stay at five star properties. At the price we paid ($1000 per night), we were sadly misled on several points. First, I booked through Starwood SPG. I was told we were getting 35% off rack rate, so with taxes, a bargain $1,000 USD per night for 5 nights for a partial ocean view cottage. As a Gold SPG member I asked for upgrade at check in if available, but this request was not honored, the girl that checked us in wouldn't even check availability. I was tired from the flight, so I didn't make a fuss. Well, just out of curiosity, I checked online for the rate and found that I could have booked online through Westin and got $850 per night. So I was charged over the internet rate when I was suppose to get a "deal?" When I brought this to the attention of the front desk and then SPG, nobody is sympathetic, what would you expect, I am the sucker that got scammed. Then the Sunset Key Westin property itself, quality of Comfort Inn service dressed up in Westin garb. At the Four Seasons everyone smiles and knows your name. Here, everyone seems miserable, no smiles. The lone person "tending" the beach acts like he is doing you a favor and wish you would leave his beach and the dreadful pigeons that litter the small sad beach. The 50% gravel 50% sand beach is not combed at all, littered with cigarettes everywhere, really quite disgusting. We spent ten minutes and left. Nobody goes to Key West for the beach anyway, but this stretch of gravel is not worth walking on. The sand was supposedly brought in from the Bahamas, of course they had to, since this resort is built on landfill without natural sand. Well, over time the imported sand has eroded. Then the Sunset Key Westin cottages ... there is a serious ant problem. Small little critters came to visit as we checked in. They swarmed to any residue toothpaste, which was leftover from the last occupant. This tells you how much house keeping pays attention to details. We have a video of the ants swarming, which I will post to You Tube later. We called the front desk about the ants right away, and the girl was not surprised. But to our dismay, they also did not take care of it during our stay so the ants visited reliably every night. The Sunset Key Westin cottage is stocked with junk food at the standard gouge rate, just pick something up at CVS on Front Street and save a few hundred bucks. The room service and the restaurant Latitude are very average hotel food, the expected gouge price, with view of the neighboring petite landfill (just check Google earth to see for yourself), better you hike on to the island and have a real meal at A+B. The positives ... the ferry captains are nice guys, the pool is fairly empty as the island appeared fairly sparsely occupied. I learned this lesson the hard way, the waste of money really pales against the waste of time I spent at Sunset "Tank Island" Keys. The sun set on this mistake of land development sometime ago. Buyer beware of this Sunset Key Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Place”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth O
Reviews.Content: Beautiful relaxing place. Loved everything about it. 5 Star Resort, outstanding cottages, excellent food, relaxing spa, attentive staff and private island!! Expensive but worth every dime.

Reviews.Title: “Complete separation from chaos. Close enough to get frenetic when you want.”
Reviews.Author: k f
Reviews.Content: If you get too close to the edge try a quality massage from Susan at the Westin Key West adjacent to Mallory Square. Otherwise Cottages are a serene location with quality food at Latitudes, an attentive staff that keeps the resort afloat and attends to every need. The spa and the gym are very well appointed for their size.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise that cost a lot”
Reviews.Author: Dominique R
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place but prices are through the roof. Good idea to go for vacation and share a cottage with friends. Great if you're spending most of your time on the resort. Wonderful sunset views. Loved everything about it except for the price....that's why 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Captain Jim!”
Reviews.Author: mxpro
Reviews.Content: Captain Jim saved our Thanksgiving dinner with a private boat ride to the island when we had missed the main shuttle. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: mandim82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in Monday morning. From the time we arrived on the island everybody was super nice. Ralphardo helped us and provided excellent customer service being extremely helpful and friendly. The cottages were beautiful ad the island is very clean. The restaurant located on the island Latitudes is also a nice touch. The soups are wonderful, especially the lobster bisque. The yellowfin tuna appetizers was also nice. We will defiitely make this a regular trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sunset key just average - avoid the spa”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDodo
Reviews.Content: Hello, my husband and I are currently staying at Sunset Key and checking out tmrw. We are Gold Spg members so were happy to get a free upgrade to a partial ocean view room and we also own a Westin property so have been to many Starwood properties in the world. The check in experience was great, no problems and we definitely love that the boats to and from the main island is on time. But after spending $1000 on spa services for my husband and I, our experience here is leaving a bad taste in our mouth. Our spot was for 1pm and were told to get there for 12:45 which we did. We were asked to sit and wait and have drinks but there were no glasses and cups. We finally got served around 1:20 and my original massage with stones was missed so I had to settle for an alternative massage because it would take too long to heat the stones. After I took a shower in the room, not even having a chance to sit in the garden, I get a knock on the door telling me that there was another appointment so I was rushed out and this happened to my husband too even though he was in a seperate room. We are regular spa goers and were surprised that the attention to detail was missed, ie no robes, no water after and was rushed out even though they started late. And it was freezing cold and I had to ask for a heating pad. Hotel is great but avoid the spa, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Calm serenity in the chaos of Key West.”
Reviews.Author: MichelleC7127
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a long weekend for our 15th wedding anniversary with friends also celebrating 15 years. We had a 3 bedroom cottage overlooking the pool area. Beautiful rooms, private bathrooms - everything well appointed. Breakfast every morning brought to your room. Service was terrific. The launch back and forth between the island and Key West was terrific and timely. Latitudes restaurant was delicious with perfect views. The new spa was wonderful also. They have everything you could need from fishing pools to basketballs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Island in the Keys, Did Not Want to Leave!”
Reviews.Author: Seashell100
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful, sophisticated, but casual and comfortable. Gorgeous landscaping, perfect attention to detail, and fantastic service from the staff at the Westin Marina who parked our car, to the staff at Sunset Key, to the concierge, Zena, who checked us in, and rest of staff that granted our every wish with a smile and quick service. This was a "girl's trip" with a group of 8, and everyone of us was amazed! We took advantage of the get two bedrooms for the one bedroom cottage rate, booked two cottages and it was a bargain! From the spacious bedrooms, abundant baths (3 full), and the ever satisfying heavenly beds, it was all perfect.. Loved the decor, solidly built and quiet cottages, the breakfast basket delivered each morning, the prompt boat, the beach, and the relaxing pool, it was all top notch. Been traveling to Florida ( all parts for decades) and never been impressed by the food, but Latitudes blew us away! Had appetizers in the bar, breakfast, lunch at the beach and a dinner, and ALL we were delicious, artfully presented, and represented he Keys flavors. We are still raving about the coconut lime risotto served in the coconut shell ( forgot to ask for recipe). A couple of slight negatives, were the small roped off swimming area, and the large rocks in the water that hurt the feet. Housekeeping was friendly, but not thorough and one day, the pool and beach staff were scarce (but it was not at all crowded and we had them mostly to ourselves. Don't hesitate a moment to book a trip here, you will not be disappointed, and will love it! Once there, you will not want to leave, we didn't. Can't wait to return, or if I win the lottery, I have my eye on any of the residences there!

Reviews.Title: “Something special under the sun”
Reviews.Author: Brad34182
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying on the island since the very first year that it was opened back when prices were in the $ 200's a night.:) 14 years ago? I found the island in a magazine and took my wife and three children there for her birthday. The island is one of the nicest most secluded, peaceful, secure experiences that we have found in our travels catering perfectly to our family. We try to visit two or three times a year and have both driven and flown to Key West to stay there. The family uses the island for their base of operations to explore Key West while I am working during the day. We have literally stayed in every one of the interior cottages near the pool, both 2 and 3 bedrooms and have seen every change from decorating to staff to facilities. It took some getting used to when they changed the pool from chlorine to salt and we miss several of the menu items that the pool bar Latitudes has gone through over the years but we have embraced all the changes and still love the experience. You can ask anything of the staff and they will attempt to do it. There are a great many Eastern Europeans employed on the island and there are some cultural gaffes which I think explain some of the complaints of other travelers. The room service is from their restaurant and is excellent. I do agree that the rooms are getting more and more pricey and during holidays can be prohibitive for the experience but that may be because we have seen the lower pricing. They do run specials on the website that lower the nightly stays. The rooms are not large or well appointed but who wants to stay in the room with where you are? It is worth the experience - a "secluded" tropical getaway 10 minutes from the madness of Key West. The Key has better sunset views than Mallory Square - the island actually blocks their view of the sunset. Try it and whether you like it or not you will remember it for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Treated beautifully...”
Reviews.Author: EnglshmaninNY
Reviews.Content: When I visited Sunset Key, the dock and boat staff were brilliant as were the facility and all the amenities. Clean, fun, bright and particularly professional, it was the "ultimate" Florida experience. The food was lovely, everyone was courteous, and I was even offered help on and off the boat. Everything was fresh and pleasant; there were massive crowds of people and each individual was treated with respect in spite of the rush. I do understand where the "security" factor might be misinterpreted; however there are private residents on the island and the job of the staff is to make sure no one gets across without an appropriate pass. I reiterate that in my experience none of the staff I encountered was in the slightest disrespectful. I am not sure where the miserable, overwrought review previous to mine stems from, but my experience was indeed the opposite and I cannot wait to visit again. Perhaps I am just easier to please. Respectfully submitted.

Reviews.Title: “Two excellent visits”
Reviews.Author: CTBeth
Reviews.Content: Sunset Key was the perfect resort for our family trips. We went there twice in a couple years and rented a 3-bedroom unit for my in-laws, children and us. Yes, it's pricey, but we felt it was worth every penny: beautiful villa overlooking the beach on one side and gardens on the other, full kitchen and living area so we could all be together and cook simple meals, and a private bathroom for the grandparents. The pool is fantastic, but to have an actual beach at a Key West hotel is a real treat! The ferry to Key West came frequently and only took a few minutes. The best of both worlds- a quiet, family setting at the resort, and all the fun of downtown Key West just minutes away. Can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in the Keys!”
Reviews.Author: DebSTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: I have been to Key West many many times.... brought family out this time so we wanted something very special. The Sunset Key Cottages were beyond beautiful! Everyone on the island was so very nice... the cottages more than you could ask for! Very fast boat service back and forth to the center of Key West's entertainment area. We really didnt want to leave the beach and the pool. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Way over-priced. Dont get fooled by the pictures.”
Reviews.Author: Blacklist7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly because of it's "uniqueness" among the other hotels in key west, I wanted to surprise my wife with a nice hotel stay for our honeymoon. My friend actually booked the stay for us, but she forgot to ask for the honeymoon package (they have a promotion until the end of september, which you get the 5th night free when you stay for 4 nights), so she only booked 4 nights stay and I called the hotel and see if I could at least get a bottle of champagne for free which is included in the package along with the chocolate covered strawberries, I didnt ask for the 5th night because the friend booked the return flight as well..... only the lady who answered the phone rudely told me it's a non-changeable, non-refundable package, and I will have to pay to get my champagne... ok Fine! The first day I found garbage (chocolate wraps) in the basket with the snacks.... The cleaning service is really bad after the 2nd day, I'm not sure if they don't like the tips i left there or something, I see electric wire "suddenly" appear on my carpet after they cleaned our room, let alone the choclate wraps were still in the snacks basket on the day we check out...(August 12th 2011). Also on Wed August 10th 2011, a guy barged in and come up halfway of the stairs to ask us if we need service at around 9am... (check out time is 11am... ) I am not a frequent traveller, not sure if that's normal, but I havent have that experience before and I found it very rude. The beach... it's beautiful but it's WAY TOO SMALL, you can't swim in that beach, which is next to the ferry dock as the other user saigeey pointed out, and there are lots of broken shells and rocks near the water. The pool guy was cleaning the sides of the pool trying to remove the black mold according to him, but I was upset he has to do it at 10am where almost 15 ppl including kids were in the pool.... he did nicely told me those white powder he used is similar to chlorine which will not hurt our skin if small amount was used, but we decided to move to the beach instead. One bright spot for this hotel is the restaurant, the Lobster bisque was the best I've ever tasted. Overally, I paid 600USD a night and I think it's not worth it, unless you think the ferry ride and nice atmosphere is worth 600USD, hotel is beautiful, but the room is not that luxury as I expected.

Reviews.Title: “As Great as Ever”
Reviews.Author: acesn28
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for her birthday, along with 3 other couples for a 5 day stay at Sunset Key guest cottages. We rented 2 - 2 bedroom cottages which were fantastic. Zina, our concierge, along with the whole staff were amazing. Before the trip we made several requests to change the cottages to get closer, right area, ECT. They were incredible accommodating to each request and even called back with suggestions as cottages became available. When you arrive to the island by boat, someone is there to greet you and makes sure you feel welcomed and special. You don' have to track someone down for your bags; it is all taken care of by the staff. When we walked in our cottage there was a huge basket of flowers, a card, and Champaign (the champagne I requested and paid for) on the table for my wifeâ€™s birthday. It was like everyone that worked there knew it my wifeâ€™s birthday and went out of their way to tell her. 2 of the maids were headed back to Jamaica and stopped by to give her a hug and a sincere Happy Birthday. The island itself is beautiful. Each Cottage, the pool, the beach and even the walkways are incredibly manicured and maintained. The beach is amazing by Key West standards, easily one of the best beaches there, and I have never seen it crowded. Swimming or sitting in the hot tub at night you can see millions of stars through the palm trees swaying in the wind. Beside the service, one of the best things about the island is how secluded it is. It is nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of Key West and Duval Street when you want. Of course, it is only a 15 minute ride to get back when you want the action too. Latitudes rivals any restaurant in the keys on service ambiance and quality; and no one has a better view of the sunset. The surf and turf was my personal favorite entree, but the Wagyuâ€™ flank steak and the Mahi were amazing too. We also found the food from the pool restaurant to be great. Overall, it is an excellent resort destination and has quick access to a great island town. All of which made for an amazing vacationâ€¦again. We canâ€™t wait to visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: LynnGibb
Reviews.Content: As Native Floridians with a family of six, we've made a habit of enjoying all of the splendor that our state has to offer when we vacation. We've been to the Keys many times, but have never experienced such an awe inspiring tropical setting which is only a five minute boat ride away from all the activities that Key West has to offer! The island is private and exclusive. We were always able to find a cushioned lounge chair at the pool or the private beach under a tiki umbrella. We were surprised to find that there was a beach attendant to bring us towels, drinks or food. Make sure to bring water shoes as the beach is quite rocky at the water's edge, but once you get in- it is spectacular! Our vacation was the perfect combination of relaxation, sight seeing and dining. Try Lattitudes! For lunch or dinner, the views are the best we've ever seen and the food and service is just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accomdation and setting....service holds it back to a 4”
Reviews.Author: Sydney20000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sunset Key Cottages in early July for 4 nights. There were alot of plusses....we are a family of 5 and booked a 2 BR garden cottage...was upgraded to an oceanfront cottage which was fantastic. I thought the accommodations were spacious and comfortable. The ceiling fans on the porch were terrific. The beach was nice...a bit rocky in the water, but never had a problem with beach chairs and the sunsets were great. Ordered room service the first night and the food was really good. We thought the breakfast baskets in the morning were plentiful and the food was fresh and good. The service in some areas was horrible. Housekeeping was among the worst we have ever seen. We had to ask to have the room serviced on one day. On another day, we again asked to have the room serviced and the cleaners who were outside of our unit told us it was not theirs to clean! When if fact it was. When they did "clean" they exchanged towels and "made beds"...that's it. We had to ask for shampoo, we had to ask someone to come and vacuum the rooms of sand, etc. Absolutely pathetic. The concierge was pleasant but really had no clue on the services that were offered. I asked about parasailing and was told the parasailing companies close at 5, when in fact, they close at least at 6 and people were out until 7 or 730. The staff just did not seem to have a clue about what services were offered, the pricing, the times, etc. HOWEVER, Justin was the one shining star. He was always attentive, very knowledgeable, dropped everything that he was doing to help, etc....terrific, terrific job Justin! We ate at the restaurant one night...food was good....very expensive...while our server did an ok job, there was not a "thanks for dining with us" from the server, the hostess when we walked past her, or anyone else....I thought that was odd. We would come back to property though. I noticed that others thought the service levels were below par. If they got the service to the level of prices that they charge, this would be 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience; great option for Key West for a family”
Reviews.Author: CheerGator84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an oceanfront two bedroom cottage in Sunset Key. Positives: a lot of nice extras (such as breakfast basket delivered each morning), wonderful beach and pool areas, delicious food and drinks @ restaurant (Latitudes), private & quiet. Ferry to Key West is a few minutes and runs every half hour (free with cottage). Cottage was very nice with a small kitchen, good beds, 3 full bathrooms and a wonderful porch that leads out to the sand/ocean. Parked at the Westin @ KeyWest and their customer service was very good. Negatives: housekeeping was not very attentive or friendly; not much space to go if you are a runner/walker; beach is a bit rocky so bring water shoes. If you want to have a beach while in Key West, this is a good option. We had 5 adults and one child and slept comfortably so it was not too expensive compared to getting 2-3 hotel rooms per night. I would recommend this as a nice option for families.

Reviews.Title: “Poor concierge service, rest was average. Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: US40
Reviews.Content: It was OK but not worth the $1100,00 per night. 1. The ladies at the island-concierge desk are a mess. - They have no clue what they are doing, they have no idea what's going on in Key West and when the run out of excuses the are plain out rude to their guests. 2. Our grocery delivery (as offered by the hotel) did not arrive within 24 hours, but we had to wait 42 hours without an explanation or an adjustment to the invoice. 3. The room service menu is the same as at the "exclusive fine dining restaurant" ??!!?? 4. Our reservation was handled poorly. I went to reserve 4 days in advance for our daughter's birthday and asks for an outside table for our daughter's birthday. When we got there we were seated in the back of the patio and I was told I should have asked for "an ocean-table". - How am I supposed to know what their dumb tables are called? Four days in advance! Hotel guest! Birthday! Outside! 5. Carpets in the bedrooms a very rough and hurt your feet when you walk on them!? 6. The hotel beach is nice, but the swimming area is poor. It's a small area next to the ferry landing. 7. Internet didn't work for the last two days. Nobody let us know the status or if it will come back up, nobody offered alternatives or assistance. That's problematic if you have to work and relay on their service. What we liked: Bell service was prompt, free internet (when in worked), fishing rods and bait provided for the children, breakfast basket in the morning, reliable and punctual ferry service, the small, quiet pool. We stay at Westin all the time (spg members), we like the chain, but we would not stay at that resort again simply because the ask 5 star prices for a 4 star location, 4 star rooms and 2 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but needs to work on Customer Service (Concierge)”
Reviews.Author: builder88
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time to Sunset Key in less than three years. My wife and I love this place. We traveled with her parents on this trip. Sunset Key is an amazing little island, it is a 10 minute ferry ride to Key West. We would stay on the island all day and then go into town for dinner at night. The Island landscaping is superb, they are always trimming and watering and planting it really is a lush tropical island makes it feel more secluded than it is. The views for Sunset are better than anywhere on the actual Island of key west. The food at the restaurant for dinner or for lunch is excellent not cheap, but great food and you get what you pay for. The bar tender at the bar Marcus (spelling may be wrong), is the best bar tender we have been around. Very professional friendly, my drinks were always great and I never even had to ask for another he just knew. My wife would just tell him kind of what she wanted and he would make it perfect every time. He is the kind of employee that most companies would dream to have. I hope they appreciate his service as much as we did. Only big problem for me was the concierge (One person to be exact). I had called her and told her that we were getting in early the next day and wanted to know if we could get an early check in. She told me that we could check in at 12:00 as she knew the party that was staying in our cottage was leaving earlier., (This was the day before we got there). We get to the Island at 12 and she greets us, I explain that I talked to her on the phone and she tells me that she did not say 12, but that our cottage would not be ready for another 2 hours. These cottages are not even 1000 sq ft, I am a home builder and have cleaned hundreds of houses I could have cleaned the cottage in 30 minutes. We ended up waiting for 2-1/2 hours for our cottage. Once we got to our cottage, I went around and looked to see how many cottages were vacant. I would say that over 30% of the cottages (low end) were vacant, but they made us wait for 2-1/2 hours after traveling all day. This would be ok if I was staying at a $200 per night hotel but not a $1000 per day resort. She did not care and was flat out rude to me. Further more our luggage was lost by our airline and I explained to her that we needed some assistance with this matter. She did nothing to help, she did not even make a phone call, I watched her for an hour sit at her desk online. She did not even call housekeeping to try and speed up the process. After this our trip was great, until we had to deal with the concierge on our last day. Our flight did not leave key west until 6:00 pm so I called and asked her if we could check out at 2:00 pm to enjoy our last day there. She said no way we had to be out by 12. I went to the office to ask her about this, she told me they could not and that the house keeping manager and told her she could not have any late checkouts today. I asked her if I could speak to the manager of housekeeping. She reluctantly called her and the manager came to the office I explained my circumstance and she said no problem. I recognized her, because she was the old concierge and was great at her job. I can't believe that Sunset Key hired this concierge as she has no clue to what she is doing. I will go back but will talk to a manager before I book another trip. We stay at Westin Resorts all the time and love them, and get treated better at much cheaper Westins than Sunset Key. Great place that I will go back to but this one person was horrible. I would like to know what Justin's response is to this. The island was not fully booked the day we arrived and left and she treated us very poorly. I have never had this problem at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: LTSchall
Reviews.Content: The resort is amazing and I would refer any friend to go, the food is amazing and to be able to catch a ferry to go to more civilization is great! I prefer to stay in a quiet area and go out if needed. The beaches in Key West are not great and to have a private beach and be waited on is great! They could use some more rafts! The cleaning service was not great, we had to call to have them clean for us one time - but that can be fixed!!! In my ratings for cleanliness is only due to them not keeping up with that in your room. The cleanliness of the overall resort was great. The service was great, except room service!

Reviews.Title: “fun!”
Reviews.Author: bump
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in a three bedroom villa, each room with a King bed and bath, opening to a patio with fantastic sunset waterfront views! The island is a 10 minute ferry ride to Key West for shopping and Bars! Peaceful and elegant. We could sit on the patio and watch the sunset, eat at the fantastic restaurant, or take the boat into Key West for a crazy evening. we will return often!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and are coming back next year!!”
Reviews.Author: tcoop35226
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Westin and my husband is in a wheelchair and was told that our oceanfront cottage would be accessible and imagine my surprise when I called the week before our trip to make sure everything would be "perfect" that I was told that in fact the cottage was not accessible. Shannon referred me to Justin and I cannot say enough praises for Justin and the time he took with us to change our cottage to the accessible cottage that Westin renovated specifcally for wheelchair accessibility. Justin sent pictures of the cottage so we would know what the room would be like when we arrived and his personal attention to make sure we were comfortable before we arrived was priceless. We ate at Lattitudes for a sunset dinner while we were there and the food was absolutely fabulous. The beach service was great--whenever I wanted a refill for my Key West Colada--I only had to look up to find someone to "fetch" it for me!! We will be coming back next year with our two daughters and our granddaughter and introduce her to the Key West way of life!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: wildhare19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated 31st anniversary in a cottage with garden view/ partial ocean view. Decor was very nice with no sign of a scratchy sisal carpet that another reviewer found objectionable- our cottage has wall to wall carpet. The AC unit was noisy and it did sometimes wake me when it start or stopped. Great bed and linens! Breakfast with muffins. fruit and newspaper was left on the porch each morning. I loved peeking into the basket each morning. It was more than enough for us. Orange juice, bottled water and two chocolates were delivered the night before. We did pop over to Key West CVS to pick up some yogurt, cereal and milk to have in the cottage. The pool was very beautiful in the midst of lush vegetation. But the ocean always called us. It was calm and floats are available to use. We had no problem securing an umbrella and chairs on the beach. There was some saving of chairs going on but it was unnecessary. I only saw the folks in a oceanfront cottage doing this. I can't blame them for waiting chairs in front of their unit. Ferry ride was so easy and convenient. Not to mention it was just fun. Makes for a quiet island since no cars. The resort restaurant, Latitudes, was excellent and waiters were happy to take photos of diners during sunset. The sunset is such a big deal, all eating stops and the cameras are pulled out and it's all about the sunset for next little while. Key West was good for people watching but every time we journeyed over, we really wanted to get back to our Fantasy Island. Nice staff that were always available to us. A beautiful cheese and fruit tray was sent to our room as an anniversary surprise. A parting gift was delivered as well. I won't tell what it was, so you'll be surprised if you should decide to go yourself. Only negatives: AC noise did disturb me but wouldn't keep me from returning. The price point demands a generous budget, but it was a special occasion for us- 31st wedding anniversary and my cancerversary. We would return tomorrow if possible.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: mkb5497
Reviews.Content: First off, Westin has always been a favorite for us. We arrived an hour before check in and was told our room was not ready but in the same instant were told we had been upgraded to a choice of a one bedroom ocean front suite, or a garden view cottage at Sunset Key. We chose the suite originally but after a fantastic lunch at their Bistro and talking to our waiter we called to switch to the cottages. I am sooooo very glad of that decision. The cottages are very secluded with beautiful grounds, beach, and pool. Our cottage Tropical Air was steps away from one of the hot tubs and pool. The staff was pleasant on arrival. I did notice on our first morning, there weren't any pool towels or staff, but it was early and after walking to the beach there were a few towels there but soon the staff came to refill the towel bins. Our cottage was decorated beautifully and very clean, and I'm very picky with bathrooms/bathtubs/showers. We had a 2 bedroom 3 bath cottage with kitchen, dining, living room, stereo, 3 TVs, wrap around porch with rockers....I can go on and on. I'm sad to see the previous review was not satisfied and yes, I could probably find something to complain about (the roped area rug in the bedrooms were perfect for the decor and yes a little hard on the feet but I placed my slippers or flip flops by the bed). There are LOTS of weddings, especially on the weekend and we were told on arrival of how busy the restaurant would be that night. We were here for a wedding as well the following night and totally understood. The boat shuttle ran like clock work to and from the hotel with ample room for whoever was waiting. The hotel itself is steps away from main attractions so we didn't see our car until check out. I really could go on and on and still couldn't tell you everything, must experience it yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place but has some serious flaws”
Reviews.Author: travel141
Reviews.Content: Sunset Key markets itself as a luxury resort and commands luxury prices accordingly. Unfortunately, anyone who has stayed at other high-end properties (Four Seasons, Ritz, etc) will quickly see that Sunset Key does not offer a luxury experience. First, the good stuff: The island itself is gorgeous and the cottages are nice enough. The food was fantastic. In 7 days I don't think I had a bad meal. Now, the not-so-good stuff: The resort seemed woefully understaffed. One of the biggest issues was the lack of full-time staff at the pool and at the beach. Both areas were very "do it yourself." Get your own towels, find your own chair, etc. I've never had to do that at similarly-priced hotels, but no big deal. I can do that. The problem is, however, that this allows for lots of "chair saving" to the extreme. The resort was very full and several parties were "saving" beach chairs by throwing magazines on them at 8 am and then returning several hours later when they were ready for a dip. One day I counted over 15 chairs that clearly were not being used, and yet they were being "saved" by a single flip-flop or People magazine. As a result, some days we literally could not find an open chair at the pool or beach. I would expect this sort of thing if we stayed at a mid-priced hotel on the mainland, but here we were paying over $1,300/night and my family of 3 had to share one chair some days. We brought this issue up with 2 different staff members (one at the pool and one at the front desk) but nothing ever changed. And yet if the pool & beach had full-time staff setting people up with towels, clearing chairs when people left, etc then it wouldn't be an issue. Instead, they had one guy intermittently standing by the towels (he split his time between the pool & beach) and the poolside restaurant employees picking up the slack when they had time. Another pool/beach issue, was a lack of towels period. If you were lucky enough to get a chair, you might or might not have a towel because half the time the towel caddy was empty. And because there was never anyone working at the pool, it was impossible to get any assistance. On two occasions we had to ask the poolside restaurant staff and one time my husband had to call the front desk from his cell phone. Each time we wait over 45 minutes before any towels actually appeared. The restaurant also seemed very understaffed. While the food was delicious, service was slow and unpredictable. During one particularly slow morning, we were told that our waiter had actually gone to deliver a room service meal and that's why we hadn't seen him in a while. Really?? On one of the busiest weeks of the year, why do you have waiters splitting their time between serving restaurant guests and delivering food to the cottages? One last issue I'll mention had to do with boxed lunches. We had booked a seaplane trip to the Dry Tortugas one day and I decided to order boxed lunches from the restaurant. The dining guide indicated that the lunches must be ordered 24 hours in advance, so I made sure to do this. I explained to the person taking the order that we needed them at 8:45 am sharp because we needed to be on the first boat out in order to make our seaplane departure time. That morning at 8:30 am I reminded the hostess at the restaurant (while we were eating breakfast) that I was picking up boxed lunches and needed them by 8:45. She said "sure, no problem." At 8:45 we settled our breakfast tab and I approached her to grab the lunches. She asked me to wait a minute while she checked in the back. Then she came back out and said they were still making them! I ordered them 24 hours in advance and even gave them a reminder at 8:30! In the end, they got them to us at 8:55 and then we ran with them down the pier to catch the boat before it left. Why was this even an issue? I just don't understand. So those were some of the bigger problems we dealt with while staying on Sunset Key. In general, it just did not have the service you would expect at a luxury property. Everything just seemed so inconsistent and stuff was constantly falling through the cracks. While we were there, I read the other reviews here and noticed that the management frequently responded to criticism by saying "you should have spoken to someone here and we could have made things better" so my husband did walk down to the desk to discuss all these issues with a staff member. The woman was listened very genuinely and was very apologetic, but it didn't change anything. They sent us a fruit basket which was a nice gesture, but then the next day we were still fighting for chairs and/or towels again at the pool. There really wasn't much they could do. They couldn't hire more staff in the remaining time we had there, or re-train the ones they had, so obviously not much could be done. All in all, we had a great time on this trip because we love Key West and we loved the location of the resort. But we were quite disappointed in our resort experience and definitely won't be returning to Sunset Key.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, ideal location, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Baipie
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Sunset Key and had a wonderful time. Had a four bedroom cottage that was spectacular. The problem I had was that the management and service was that of a two star resort. First if your are a starwood preferred member, forget about all privileges. They honor non of the benefits listed. Pardon me...benefits are at their discretion. They are booked all of the time so forget late checkout. Don't beg, doesn't work. Maid service? Maybe when you call...again and again. Management didn't even know their is a washer and dryer in the room. Found that on my own. Personal chef as advertised on the website? No. If you go to the pool, bring your own towel...my wife asked for one and was told to chill and get a drink while she waited for one. I could go on. Again...the facility is outstanding, but watch out for the fine print. Would I recommend this resort to a friend?

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Dwimr
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Key West (two adults, two 17 year-old girls) and had a great time, due in no small part to Sunset Key Cottages. We paid a lot of money but I have to admit it was worth it. The water taxi was always readily available and everyone at the resort was pleasant and helpful. Dinner at Latitudes was a highlight of the trip (try to get a reservation near sunset.) The cottage was roomy and nicely appointed. The girls enjoyed the pool and beach. If your vacation budget is roomy, I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: KKfromBoston
Reviews.Content: For the past nine years, 6 college friends have met at Sunset Key to enjoy the Sun, Fun and hospitality. Every year when we leave we bid farewell until next year. All of the staff is great but a special thank you to Becky in the concierge office who made everything extra special this year. And Captain Tim for always making the trip back and for to Key West a breeze. Kathy from Boston

Reviews.Title: “It's a Westin that needs a huge capital improvement!”
Reviews.Author: nycitaliantraveler
Reviews.Content: We pulled up to the Westin valet and sat in our car and waited and waited and waited. The bellmen were not interested in helping. We got out of the car and found a luggage cart. The moment I put my hands on one, the most unfriendly, poorly groomed valet said, "I need to take this from you." I replied, to help us or just to take? He said someone would help in a bit. We then went into the main lobby of the Westin and were helped by another unfriendly woman. We asked if they had coffee available and she said, "we have nothing complimentary." You just missed the boat launch. The next one is in 20 minutes. That was our greeting for our 1k/night stay at Westin sunset key "resort". At the boat launch pier there is no seating and no water. If you are traveling with physically challenged family, good luck. When we arrived at our cottage, we were totally unimpressed. It was filthy. The towels are ragged and thin. The carpeting is stained and the furniture falling apart. We figured that we'd make a cocktail and called for martini glasses and a shakers but were told we could not have them. After some schmoozing we received permission for the glasses but no shaker. This property did not provide turn down service and the staff is mediocre. I'd suggest staying at a premium guest house on the mainland and passing this property.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, beautiful paradise like location.”
Reviews.Author: victoriac9
Reviews.Content: The pictures of this resort do not do it justice. It is beautiful and well maintained. The extra touches like turn down surface really make this a special retreat from the hustle and bustle of every day life. It is just far enough from the Keys themselves to make it feel like remote but close enough that you have all the shopping, dining and nightlife you want 10 minutes away. Highly recommend as a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Best High End Hotel in Key West for business or leaisure”
Reviews.Author: SteveK1958
Reviews.Content: The Sunset Key Guest cottages are a little paradise in Key West. The best of both worlds- exceptional service, amenities and accomodations within minutes of the Key West nightlife and dining experience. Guest cottage rooms are beautiful and spacious and service is perfect. First class all the way. We had a group business meeting at Sunset Key and the Westin people took great care of us every minute of the stay. The grounds around the cottages are beautiful - including a specatacular pool AND a beach. The short boat shuttle from near Mallory Square to the cottages is easy and it runs frequently. Once you get to Sunset Key you feel like you are in a different world- more like a paradise than the typical Key West hotel experience. Highly recommended for business meetings although I look forward to coming back for a romantic getaway as well.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Sionn
Reviews.Content: Our second stay in this paradise only a short boat ride from Key West. The best of both worlds- pure luxury with a world class restaurant, private beach, spectacular pool with bar and restaurant(lunch only), spa and workout facilities, great concierge services, beautiful accommodations in a spectacular setting, with the ability to enjoy the great restaurants and activities of Key West. The prices are not for the faint of heart- the accommodations, food, drinks are very expensive, but I feel worth it. You get what you pay for. One of my all time favorite places

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: BridgeB0
Reviews.Content: When I travel, I always stay at 4-5 star properties. I have never in my life had more trouble getting information about a resort than I have with Sunset Key. I tried to call the local number for the resort for about 20 minutes this morning, and each time the call went to a hotel other than Sunset Key. You cannot even call the actual resort at Sunset Key to ask them questions. Each time my call was attempted to be transferred to Sunset Key, I was placed into voicemail. My voicemail is yet to be returned. Starwood is running several promotions at the hotel, but with blackout dates. So, being flexible with my dates, I next called Starwood to determine what the blackout dates are. I was informed by SPG that they didn't actually have a list of the blackout dates. So apparently no one at Starwood actually knows what the blackout dates are. Makes you wonder if there are any non-blackout dates and the offers are a complete sham.

Reviews.Title: “unbelieveable”
Reviews.Author: stryker56
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the westin on susnset key was beyond words. The island is lush, quiet and exclusive. The cleaniness was superb. Everyday the rooms were refreshed and revisited.This happened throughout the day. Our breakfast basket arrived every morning with "new" goodies from the kitchen. The resort made it convenient to have groceries on hand for our hungry teenagers. The staff was always ready to assisst you in a warm friendly manner. The spa was an added treat! I recommend staying at this resort once in your life. It was expensive but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful- and we are very fussy”
Reviews.Author: teech99
Reviews.Content: perfect in every way beg, borrow or steal to get here, it's a fabulous experience if you can't afford the ocean view, the garden views are only a short stroll away and have the same decor and facilities.....the service is impeccable also.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhhhhhhhhhh!”
Reviews.Author: tntd
Reviews.Content: A private island (5 minute boat ride 24 hour service) with service from the get go. Security (although saw no sign needed) that is unobtrusive. Prompt and friendly (no stuffed shirts here). Cottages are spacious, amazingly private with foliage, easy to get to because of layout, no walking forever to get to your cottage! Absolutely well maintained grounds. Turn down service left large chocolate favors, fresh orange juice for morning and postcard for next days sunset (sunset celebration Mallory square every night) In the morning left picnic basket on your porch with fresh fruit and muffins, cakes etc for breakfast. Pool (zero entry and heated!!), beach all well equipped with towels and services - food excellent. Spa was beyond expectations as was Lattitudes restaurant, you must check out gift shop for some very interesting items, some not seen in Key West. Pool and 2 hot tubs - 24 HOURS!

Reviews.Title: “Best service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: flashSaratogaSpring
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sunset Key with 3 children and 2 adults. Stayed in 3 bed cottage plenty of room. Room service, pool side , and restaurant excellent. Nice to be able to go over to crazy key west then return to "our island". Fantastic place. Will return . Concierge Becki the best!

Reviews.Title: “quiet, romantic beautifully landscaded”
Reviews.Author: porscheLafayette_in
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a cottage not on the water, but it didn't matter. Looked out on the water from the front porch. They have thought of everything. the cottage was stocked with everything you could want, sunscreen, aloe, popcorn,soft drinks, beer, candy, nuts. everything. The whole place is just beautiful and very clean. The restaurant is very good. Steaks and sea food. The boat that takes you to key west runs every half hour,and takes about 5 mins. and always on time. Only thing, drinks are a bit expensive $15. but very good. The service around the pool and on the beach is very good, and they serve little snacks in the afternoon, that were quite nice, . Its real the best of both worlds, quiet and relaxing, go to KW and Party.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay for us!”
Reviews.Author: ellen0052
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a four day stay at Westin's Sunset Key. I use Trip Adviser regularly. Admittedly, this is my first post. While I initially had booked elsewhere in Key West (due to the recent negative reviews about Sunset Key ), upon arriving in Key West we decided to move over to Sunset Key and were very glad we did. From check in, lodging, meals, daily requirements and check out we were treated very well by all staff. Our partial ocean view two bedroom cottage was great! The restaurant ambiance and food was fantastic. As a business owner and frequent business traveller, I have stayed in numerous hotels and resorts across North America and Europe at all price ranges. I feel that Sunset Key is definitely good value for the dollar spent, as compared to other hotel or resort locations at a similar price point. If we are able, we are making plans to return in May 2011, only this time we hope to bring our two twenty-ish son and daughter with us. A message for all travellers. A trip is what you make of it. There can and will always be issues wherever you stay and whatever you pay. Don't sweat the small stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Good place with few concerns”
Reviews.Author: panthere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to celebrate my 30th birthday at the Sunset Key Cottages. We were looking for a place with a kitchen (bc of our dietary restrictions) and the cottages looked really good. We brought our assistant/caregiver with us. Prior to our arrival, I emailed the concierge a couple of times with questions. When I didnâ€™t get any reply I called them directly. They apologized for not answering and promised to be more diligent. I requested a portable fan for each bedroom and removal of all scented products including toiletries from the cottage (we are sensitive to perfumes). We booked one of the four bedroom cottages at the hotel. They are both next to the restaurant. I requested the cottage that is further away from the restaurant because of the possible noise. I called a day before confirming all our requests. The day we arrived, we checked in at the Westin before going to the boat. We both have a chronic medical condition and have a difficult time walking even a short distance. They walked us to the boat ramp through a parking garage (not very scenic!). We both had to take a break sitting down on some old mattresses at the dump in the garage questioning our decision to come on vacation (we havenâ€™t been in couple of years). But after resting, we made it to the boat and finally got to the other side! There we were met with a golf cart that took us to our cottage. We got the one next to the restaurant in spite of my request! We thought the other cottage was already booked for the stay, but every day that passed we saw nobody in the other cottage. So, that was definitely disappointing. For the other requests: they did place portable fans in every room, but did not remove any toiletries which were pretty smelly! The four bedroom cottages opened in April of 2010. Our cottage looked brand new. There was one bedroom downstairs and 3 bedrooms upstairs. It had a very nice kitchen with everything you needed to cook your meals. I cannot comment on the housecleaning as we only used them to change towels and grab garbage. The cottage had a small pool in the back with a fountain. The fountain was pretty loud (probably built to block the sound from the neighboring restaurant), but they were able to turn it off when we requested. Also, the other cottage has a better backyard; more space and gets much more sun in the winter than ours. We had a huge palm tree blocking a lot of the sun. The food at the hotel was delicious. We had one dinner and 2 lunches at their restaurant and the quality was really good. Room service was super fast and they were able to accommodate our requests with no problem. The menu though didnâ€™t change for the whole stay so it would have been nice to have more options. The spa was right next to the cottage. I got an updo and mani/pedi. Both services were excellent. The spa carries Jane Iredale make up which I was really happy to see as it is one of the more natural lines out there. It also carried some vegan hair brand though I canâ€™t remember the name of it. We went to the public pool once. The pool area is quite large with lots of seating and thereâ€™s a bar in the area. One complaint I have is the loud music being played at the pool area. It is not very conducive to relaxation. Plus everyone in this day and age has their own ipod if they want to listen to music! The beach area is very nice with lots of lounge chairs and little huts to provide shade. However, I do have one complaint. The shuttle boat that comes every half hour to the island goes right next to the beach and you get a nice whiff of gas fumes every time that happens! On the same point, while we were at the pool at the cottage you could smell the gas fumes depending on the wind direction. So we had to go back inside the cottage every time the boat came. For the last 3 days of our trip, the wireless internet stopped working. The concierge couldnâ€™t give us any details on when it would be back. They did try to assure us that they would fix it fast, but even on the last day of our trip, it still wasnâ€™t working. The day before our departure I requested a wheel chair for my husband on the other side as he had a lot of trouble walking when we arrived. The concierge said no problem. When we checked out, I asked the concierge about the wheel chair and she said someone is waiting on the other side with it. So, I thought no problem. When we arrive on the other side, thereâ€™s no wheel chair! I ask the boat captain and he says that nobody told him about the wheel chair. They start calling the hotel and it seems nobody knows whatâ€™s happening. There was a guy in a golf cart around the area and the boat captain asked him to drive us to the front of the hotel. I donâ€™t think he works for the hotel. He looked like someone taking care of the broadwalk area. So, it worked out fine in the end, but the incident speaks about the level of service in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping a bit at Sunset Key”
Reviews.Author: Creekcrawler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our latest trip (have visited SK perhaps 8 times over past dozen years). On the plus side, there is a new building that houses the restaurant and a new workout facility. This was very nice and seems to indicate a commitment to the island. On the other hand, service and overall hospitality has slipped a great deal over the past couple years. The cottages interiors are in need of sprucing up in order to command the huge prices this place seeks. Overall an average quality property in an excellent location. Big improvements will need to be made in the near term or I suspect occupancy (which was probably 20% when we were there) will disappear. The staff seems to lack the ability or desire to solve issues . As my wife said when we were leaving...this place holds lots of good memories for us over a number of years but that is in danger of being eroded . We were there 4 days and the internet was down for most of this time. In 2010 you can't operate that way for long. We will likely not be back until we see the quality of the experience improve.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place, sub-par service and value”
Reviews.Author: 79jcg
Reviews.Content: We visited for our honeymoon, and had reservations at Latitudes that Sunday. Our flights were delayed, we canceled the reservations while sitting in the Atlanta airport, and we arrived on the island (finally!) about 1030 on that Sunday. Latitudes was to close about 11, and we walked back to get a quick dinner to go. The restaurant manager laughed at us, said he was closed and was sorry. When the house manager offered the room service late night menu, the restaurant manager laughed at us again and told us he'd sold all the food. SO SORRY. We had an overpriced beer out of our fridge and called it a day. Unfortunately our experiences with most of the rest of the staff was cordial but unhelpful. Managers passed us multiple times during our stay and never once asked how things were, or if there was anything they could do to make our stay more enjoyable. Overall, we felt as if we were just a number in the Westin system: not quite what you expect from a "luxury" accommodation. We very much enjoyed Carole at the Latitudes bar, and Hansa and Marcus at Flippers. Without the 3 of them, we would have been sorely disappointed with the Westin Sunset Key. The resort will always hold a special place in my heart since it is where we honeymooned, but I doubt we will return. The value for the money is just not there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Fest at Westin Sunset Key...”
Reviews.Author: Steve8557
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Cottages late on Friday evening for our weekend trip for Fantasy Fest. We were recieved with our room key and a quick check in .. Off to our boat awaiting us to take us to Sunset Guest Cottages. The rooms were beautiful and spotless. We slept and had an awesome breakfast on the island .. stayed at the sandy beach and relaxed for the day.. We partyed till the wee hours and when we got to the docks the boat and captain were waiting to take us to our room. We had an awesome time and recommed the Cottages to upper middle income families....

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ever!”
Reviews.Author: TexasLady100
Reviews.Content: Took a short vacation to Key West with a few friends to celebrate 21st birthdays for our daughters. We couldn't have been more pleased with this resort. Everything about it is quaint and cool and we took advantage of every amenity available from the beach, pool, bar, room service, exercise room, and of course dinner at sunset at Latitudes (a must). Our photos look better than postcards. What you see in the photos on their website is exactly what you get. The boat to and from the resort is very reliable and comfortable, and getting away from Key West for the quite of the resort was welcoming. We all vow to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice private resort island, but service standard doesnt meet the price tag”
Reviews.Author: Ioannis78
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2-bed cottage with our 5-month old daughter and in-laws, mainly because its the only hotel in Key West with a decent beach (so we thought). While its a beautiful and quiet resort island (just off Key West connected with shuttle boat) and disappointed on a number of accounts: check-in desk didnt communicate with concierge so we were not welcomed on arrival, rooms were not properly cleaned every day and toiletries and coffee were not restocked, beach looks nice on photos but entry is covered with small stones so you need bathing shoes and the only one hotel pool is tiny and much to warm. For all that you pay between $600-1000 per day, depending on the size/location of your cottage -> hence a brutal rip-off and we'll not go back there

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Perfection”
Reviews.Author: munchkin80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several days last weekend, as we got married on the beach surrounded by our kids in an intimate wedding. What an experience both the wedding and stay were. We had two cottages (ours was a 2 bedroom on the beach side and the kids had a 2 bedroom garden view). This would've been a great romantic getaway for two but it was exactly how we planned it - the blending of two families. Either way, you can't go wrong staying here - with or without kids. Of course, it is probably the most expensive resort in Key West but it was well worth the accommodations and location. The staff was extremely accommodating and I have to thank the Westin GM and Catering Director (as well as the Latitudes GM) for their assistance; they were three of the best and most professional hotel staff I've had the pleasure of working with. Key West beaches are known for their rocks, so beware and don some of those ugly beach booties when entering the marked off swimming areas of the beach (unless you donâ€™t mind contorting your body and face in pain when making your way across those little buggers and cursing in front of other guests). The pool was a great serene experience until a couple of loud little ones showed up; but that's to be expected, pool + kids (or drunken adults) = loud fun. Regardless, there are certain trips, places, songs and people you will always remember for one reason or another (good or bad experiences). Sunset Key Guest Cottages would be one of the great trips to remember for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Sunset Key ----- Key West ------ Tropical Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Lady&Gentlemen
Reviews.Content: Sunset Key is one of my all time favorite places to stay in Florida. It's a 27 acre oasis. The boat ride from Key West is about 5-7 minutes. When I go I stay in the private cottages facing Mallory Square on Key West. Absolutely breath taking. In the evening we jump on one of the hammocks which is roped between coconut palms, you can hear reggae music playing at a distance from Mallory Square in the evening looking up at the moon and the stars sipping on our favorite vino. The pool area is inviting, you can order a tropical drink while you bask in the sun or relax on a float in the pool. It's great to take a walk around the island to admire all the Tropical Florida Style homes ....... Once you've stayed on Sunset Key you'll want to go back time and time again. The Cottages are tastefully decorated and are spacious. The island is very laid back, a wonderful clean beautiful safe island and only a short boat ride away from many things to do and see. Keep your eyes open, you might just bump into Mr. Cheese Burger in Paradise himself "Jimmy Buffett". Sunset Key has a neat little restaurant on the the island "Lattitudes" the food was tasty food and tropical atmosphere. This is a place I would definitely recommend to family and friends. Take your Suntan Lotion, Good walking shoes for Key West.... so much to see and do there in Key West. Visit Hemingway's Home. Jump on the Trolley that takes you around Key West, you'll see many places that you will want to visit. You are allowed to jump on and off the Trolley to explore interesting shops, museums, restaurants and much more. Bring your smile and enjoy your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: fishtime
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made reservations and took four other friends of ours (2 couples) and stayed in one of the three bedroom cottages on Sunset Key. The staff at the hotel and on the fairy were all very prompt and polite. All of our belongings were taken to and from our rooms, and nothing was ever lost, stolen or broken. The cottage was very comfortable (not even comparable to a hotel). The place was quite roomy and really felt like a home. Any problems (couple of minor things) were fixed with a simple phone call. The only thing I noticed was that the place could have used a couple of repairs/upgrades. For instance, the door frame to our room was falling apart. It wasn't really an issue, but it just seemed like it should be fixed, especially for the amount of money you pay to stay there. The Island was beautiful, and very relaxing. Though I did not get a chance to visit the pool or spa area, my wife and her friends absolutely loved it! They spent quite a bit of time at the pool and on the beach. My friends and I all went fishing off of the beach and on the docks. Fishing was great, as long as you had the right bait. One thing I absolutely did not like was the staff at the restaurant (Latitudes). The first night we all (all 3 couples) decided to place an order and pick it up to bring it back to the room. The first person we spoke to seemed pretty nice, but we could not understand him so we had to speak to a second individual. If I'm not mistaken, the next person on the phone was a manager? However, they were very rude to my wife and friend on the phone. Any questions that were asked, had a very short and rude answer. Simply asking about sides and portion sizes seemed to upset the manager. I'm sorry, but when I am spending right at $200 for dinner, I expect to be treated nicely in return. When my wife and her friend went to pick up the dinner, they were also treated very rudely in person by the woman (maybe manager?) that tended to them. As much as I hated to do so, we placed another order with them the next night and had room service deliver it to our cottage. That time, the staff were a little nicer to us (after having to complain previously). Even though we were treated better on the second night eating there, If we were not all so tired, we would have left the island and eaten elsewhere. In the end, we had a great time staying at the island. When we go back, I don't think that I will be able to stay at a regular hotel or bed and breakfast after being in such a nice comfortable place like one of the cottages. One other great thing about Westin is that they were able to refer my friends and I to a great fishing charter, Captain Bill with Giggling Tarpon. Though the weather was not the greatest, it turned out to be the highlight of my trip and my friends and I were able to catch about 17-18 Dolphin (Mahi Mahi). Anyone looking for a great fishing trip, I highly recommend Captain Bill with the Giggling Tarpon.

Reviews.Title: “If One Can Capture Paradise in a Bottle You Would Want to Start with Sunset Key”
Reviews.Author: HookandTackle
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful experience! I took my wife, her sister and our 2 young daughters for our 5th wedding anniversary and stayed in the â€œMonetâ€� cottage (partial ocean view, mostly garden). The oceanfront cottages were Amazing! Jessica, one of the concierges made sure our stay would be a memorable one. I surprised my wife and her sister with a pre-arranged one hour in cottage Swedish massage. We were all surprised by a post massage delicacy; amazing strawberry dipped in chocolate platter. The masseuses were punctual, professional and fantastic! The Island was Immaculate filled with gorgeous variations of bougainvillea and other floral gems. There is always an oceanic breeze wherever you go; a subtle reminder of why you came in the first place. The pool/jacuzzi was very nice. The bar was great. The beach with its hammocks and soft sand was as good as it gets. Our cottage was impeccable and had all the amenities one can hope for. Key West Victorian Architecture, high ceilings throughout, 3 full bathrooms, ample sized bedrooms, full kitchen and living rooms.
