The daily breakfast wicker basket delivered to your front door contained a newspaper, fresh fruit, variety of danish/muffins and in our fridge we had bottles of freshly squeezed orange juice waiting for us each morning as well as coffee. What a great way to start the day! They are building a new facility for the Latitudes restaurant and a shopping arcade (looks to be ready in a couple of months). We did not experience any construction noise as others have indicated. The exterior of the new structure is completed that might explain why. Latitudes was magnificent (compliments to the chef), the ambience and food were 1st rate. On a side note, you must make it to Blue Heaven Cafe in Key West for Breakfast during your stay, well worth the wait! The ferry was very convenient (my girls loved it) and the entire staff throughout the Island was very friendly and helpful. Once you familiarize yourself with the schedule, you never have to wait. If you are looking for either a romantic getaway or just a quiet, serene family retreat this place is for you. Even though the Island views are incredible, I would still recommend watching the Sunset at Mallory Square, there is something spiritual about that place. The sidewalk entertainment, the aroma of fresh conch fritters, street music is second to none. Watching hundreds of people clap after the Sun goes down speaks for itself. I implore you to look at the attached pictures to support my opinion. We cannot wait to return to Sunset Key! A special thanks to Jessica and the entire Island staff for their special attention to detail and their wonderful hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING - FABULOUS - PHENOMENAL”
Reviews.Author: JSCMMcC
Reviews.Content: This resort was the best! 32 cottages on a private gorgeous island - with a pool and beach that felt like you were the only one there. The cottages are beautiful. The service is outstanding. We wil go back EVERY year.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Your Bill”
Reviews.Author: Weller03
Reviews.Content: Our organization held 4 day meeting here using both cottages on Sunset Key & rooms in main building. We had several meals cartered by hotel. Cookout by the pool was satisfactory & had nice dinner at Audubon House. However, our master account billing was an absolute mess. We were mis-billed, double billed, not billed at all, etc. The sales people tried to be helpful but were essential useless as the "accounting department & corporate" controlled the issues. While some minor accommodations were made, our organization was "screwed over". Nice facility, just watch your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, service not up to resort caliber”
Reviews.Author: TheVitMan
Reviews.Content: We spent about 5 days at Villa Sunset Key Feb 2009. Overall we had a great time. We stayed in the Osprey, a nice ocean side villa which was perfect for our group of 3 adults and 2 kids. Our favorite things were: the beautiful beach, the pool, breakfast muffins, the easy ferry back and forth from Key West, and Latitudes Restaurant (this last one surprised us a bit). The island is a nice private retreat from KW. The only real dislike: the service. First our villa was never swept during the days that we were there. After a couple days of muffin crumbs and sandy kid feet it would have been nice if they had cleaned the floors at least once. Some of the concierge staff was great. (They arranged a great boat trip and gave us the fishing poles, no luck though.) The other half was well below the caliber that you would expect from this level of resort (i.e. irritated at us for asking for a simple KW seafood recommendation and other simple and routine requests). We were sand to leave and I think that we would definitely want to go back if we were headed back to KW again. However we would have second thoughts about paying so much for such mediocre service, usually a Westin strength.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action, yet completely secluded”
Reviews.Author: birdsley14
Reviews.Content: This resort was all it was advertised to be. Your one set back is the five minute boat ride to and from the mainland. The beach was nice, although a little rocky. The cottages was very nice and right on the beach. We actually saw dolphons playing from our patio. We rarely saw anybody else at the resort even though we knew the cottages on either side of us were occupied. Latitudes provided good food and great views. When you do go into town, the boat to the marina lets you off right in the center of the action of Key West. There are plenty of places to eat and drink nearby. The hotspots are Sloppy Joe's, Hog's Breath Saloon, and Margaritaville (although it's a walk). If you're not into crowds, I recommend Captain Tony's (a little over priced), Joe's Tap Room (the back bara at Sloppy Joe's), and for the really secluded Grunt's (they only serve beer and wine) anice place with good prices. For food I would recommend Fogarty's, Cheeseburger, and probably the favorite place we found on our trip Willie T's. Willie T's is a bit farther down Duval, but is all open air, had good music, food, and prices. If you're into shopping, you will love Key West. Shops for shoes, clothing, and Jewelry are everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised...”
Reviews.Author: johan_roets
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a romantic few days on an island that involved not too much travel from Miami, where we spent the rest of the holidays. We also wanted to renew our wedding vows, as we do every year, and we thought doing it on the beach would be fantastic. Which caused the first problem - the folks at Sunset Key wanted a US$1 000 fee for the two of us to renew our vows on the beach with a priest. Just 3 people present, not 200 guests. We obviously made other plans and went to the oldest church in Floriday, which is located in Key West and enjoyed a wonderful ceremony. The entire resort is located on the eastern side of the island. That's bad news if you wanted to get to some sleep (all the noise from the island) or sleep late in the morning (the noise from boats in the harbour). The western side of the island, which is quiet, romantic and has wonderful sunsets, of course belongs to the wealthy property owners and is off-limits to hotel guests. The much vaunted sand on the resort beach is filled with rocks, has no visible beach attendants and looked semi-deserted and uncared for. The rooms were Ok'ish, but nothing to write home about. The restaurant menu is limited, especially at lunch. The complemetary breakfast basket consists of mouldy oranges and two-day old muffins. And its pricey. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: GuyM2
Reviews.Content: Loved the location and people. Great amenities. People were fantastic and gavea an upscale experience to the travel. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Random Thoughts of Sunset Key”
Reviews.Author: hogwild12
Reviews.Content: The good: Big bedrooms, very comfortable beds, nice bathrooms with all the amenities. Most cottages feel secluded enough due to the vegetation. I appreciated the big porches to spend my mornings. OJ and water provided in the mornings with pastry basket. Better than average muffins (similar to what you might find in Starbucks) Great lunch menu and bar drinks. Dinner at Latitudes is very good as well The bad: Unkept beach. I'm suprised they don't rake the seedweed off the beach in the mornings. The pool bar prices are incredibly expensive. $9.50 per drink. I loved them much more than most bars on the main island, but we had to go buy our own booze since the drinks cost so much. No Business Center. They pulled a laptop out for me, but i had to work on the same desk as the front desk. Needs a little more privacy for working.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Sunset Key Cottages”
Reviews.Author: pcw006
Reviews.Content: This is the most awesome place to stay! They are on the own island and you have to take a boat to get on and off. The boat leaves every 30 minutes either way. They have the most beautiful sunsets and a great restaurant to eat at. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spot For A Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: TravelDivaBoston
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Sunset Key at the end of August with 4 friends (all celebrating our 40th birthday). It was absolutely fantastic! The concierge took great care of us. We had a beautiful beachfront cottage that was very spacious. It was nice that the resort was a quiet haven during the day -- then we took the boat over to Key West and enjoyed the crazy night life! The pool was terrific (probably the biggest pool in Key West). The grounds were absolutely lovely. Included with the room was a bkfast basket (filled with muffins, fruit, & pastries) that was brought to us every morning - very nice! The service was wonderful & the concierge went out of her way to make our stay extra-special. We also spent some time renting jet skis & trying out snuba (combo of snorkeling & scuba) - which was an absolute blast! A few of the girls got massages in the room -- which were incredible!! I would highly recommend Sunset Key to anyone thinking about taking a trip to Key West who is looking for a beautiful resort that has a nice beach, pool, service, and good food in a very relaxed setting. It was perfect for our Girls Weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: GFORCECa
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely perfect. We are not the biggest Key West fans, but we are fans of the hotel. The hotel saved our vacation. Key West itself wears itself thin early on, as it is basically bar after bar mixed in with tourist T-shirt stores. Fine for a day, but that's about it. If we had been staying in town the vacation would have been terrible. But staying the Cottages was a savior and a treat. It was quiet enough to feel soitude but not so much that you could not enjoy yourselfs or felt you had to tiptoe around. The kids loved the beach, the water and fishing off the boat dock daily. We enjoyed looking out from our private porch and watching the scenery and being able to keep an eye on the kids. Each day we had a different type of adventure pick us up from the boat dock, snorkling, lobstering, parasailing, etc.... It was a great get-away with fantasitic service.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate Key West Getaway for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: JaneHarragin
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at Sunset Key and I felt like I'd had a week's vacation! The accommodations were blissful, the service was impeccable and the food at Latitudes Restaurant was delicious. The beach is lovely and the pool is expansive. I would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: balle_klorin
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay at this great location when we visited Florida last year. The island is superb, cottages clean and nice furnished and the tranquility and atmosphere excellent. My only remark is that you should work on your basket breakfast, which was a disappointment, especially from a northern Europe point of view... a couple of muffins and some fruit were not very impressive at a five star location. Some bagels or some decent bread would have been much better... The rest, perfect, great fish at the restaurant and we had a very nice waiter all three dinners. Service, great and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: builder88
Reviews.Content: Went back to Sunset key for the 2nd time in one year. My wife and I love this resort. You can have a very low key day at the beach and be on your little private island, and then you can go into town for food and entertainment whenever you please. Food at the resort is great but expensive, but what do you expect from a private island. Staff was very friendly and polite. My father in law and I fished from the pier with the poles and bait provided by the resort daily, we caught a number of great fish and had a blast doing it. The concierge where very friendly and helped us book a great fishing trip, waverunners and spa services for the ladies. We only had one major problem with the resort. We left from Colorado and had a flight cancelled due to snow, so we were delayed. We did not check in until 11:00 at night. When we got to the mainland Westin they told us we had one king bed and two doubles. I had specified that we needed a cottage with two kings when we booked trip. Had to sleep in a small bed and I am 6'4". Next morning I talked to the concierge to see what they could do and they put us in a three bedroom cottage with 2 king beds. That was great, but I paid over $800 for a 6 hour nap on a child size bed. The concierge was friendly, but told me that we stayed and there was nothing she could do about it. I wish I would have made a bigger deal about it at the time, but I guess I was too tired. Overall, it was a great trip and the best place to stay in Key West by far. I just agree with some of the other people that for the price you pay, they could work on pleasing guests a little more. Next time I go, I am going to call a manager a couple days before I get there, so I don't have deal with the bed situation again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, just okay service...”
Reviews.Author: ncydrw
Reviews.Content: On small Sunset Key, just off Key West, this beautiful beach cottage hotel can't be beat for relaxing atmosphere on a beach with spectacular ocean views and comfy, pretty plantation style beach cottages. Our two- bedroom cottage overlooked the shore, with its' own hammock strung between two palm trees. Nothing was more satisfying or relaxing than laying in the breezy hammock watching the sailboats on the clear, bright blue waters of Key West. The hotel gardens and lawns are picture perfect with lush tropical flowers and greenery. The pool area is lovely as well, with a pretty waterfall and laid back atmosphere, where the drinks and appetizers are delicious (I highly recommend the stuffed shrimp!) and the wait staff friendly and accommodating. As for the cottage, the beds are comfortable, even luxurious and the place is well designed for relaxed enjoyment in an upscale setting. The launch that transport you back and forth to Key West is handy and available from morning to night, and the staff aboard the launch are friendly and helpful. The only downside of this hotel is that for the huge price of a room in April, the service was less than stellar. It wasn't what I would expect from a 4 star hotel. When we arrived, the woman showing us around and to our cottage stated that we wouldn't get a reservation that night at Latitudes, the only restaurant on the island and where we had planned to eat. It was "slammed" with reservations that night, according to her. We called anyway to check, and they got us in. Hmmm... The coffee pot in our room was broken and the coffee that was available was enough for two people only. There were four of us in this two bedroom cottage. When we called to report it, after first trying to make coffee in vain, the staff sounded indifferent and said they would send someone to look at it. (How about "Sorry, we'll bring you a new one with enough coffee for 4 people" or "We'll send room service over with a pot of coffee"-- like we thought you said you were going to do in the first place, but apparently we misunderstood!) Anyway, noone came with a new pot or anything else, so we called room service and we were charged $20 for a pot with exactly four very small cups of coffee in it. Gee thanks. The fresh muffins and fruit that came in the morning were wonderfully delicious, but the lack of coffee was annoying. That afternoon we received a new pot, but we had to again request enough coffee for four people. It's like this--the pot was a ten-cupper. The coffee pods each made one large cup, according to the package, and there were only two of them. They don't know that? They never looked? They can't figure out that a 10 cup coffee pot isn't really compatible with a one cup coffee pod? Or that four people need at least one pod each or they will be very disgruntled when the $20 pot of coffee shows up? It was very delicious coffee for $20, I must admit, but a four star hotel with a high price tag should do better. If this were Travelodge I wouldn't even comment on it, but for over $1200/night, it's worthy of comment. To be fair, the restaurant staff and poolside sevice staff were great. The problems seemed to be with the hotel's office staff, concierge and room service, which seemed indifferent and were sluggish to respond, and often had to be called twice for the same request. The result was less than impressive sevice at a beautiful, unique beach hotel in lovely Key West. If you can accept less than four star service, this hotel is memorable and enjoyable for it's beautiful location and well maintained, pretty cottages and grounds. The stay is definitely worth it, if you don't get upset over the glitches, which seem big at the time, but fade away when you are enjoying this gem in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Property is unique and perfect -- Service and fitness center not.”
Reviews.Author: tacostuff
Reviews.Content: This is one of the more unique hotels I have stayed at, and I would definitely stay there again. Overall, the physical property is great, but the service is not what it should be. Though it is expensive, I think it is worth it. I would have given the hotel five stars, except for the service. Let me start with the property itself. The island is beautiful, truly unique, and the cottages are very nice and spacious. Each morning you get a muffin basket around 8:30, which is nice. Internet is free in the rooms, and I found the prices of things (e.g., laundry, minibar, etc.) to be reasonable. The pool and beach are nice with towel and chair service, and neither was very crowded. There are tennis courts on the island and you can get racquets and tennis balls from the concierge. For any spa services or the fitness center, you have to go to the mainland Westin. The â€œspaâ€� and â€œfitness center,â€� however, are not really worthwhile. The fitness center is tiny (only a few machines), and there is no spa (only a small dinky massage room off the fitness center). The boat ride back and forth is fun, but make sure you pay attention to what time it is! The boat leaves on the hour and half hour from the island and on the 15â€™s and 45's from the mainland. If you miss the boat, you will have to sit around for a half hour. After hours, you must call for the boat, but no big deal. The boat ride is about 5-6 minutes, and is quite fun. When you check-in, the bellmen take your luggage in a wrapped-up cart on the boat, and the concierge meets you and escorts you to your cottage. My biggest upset was the service. As other reviews have said, when you are paying over $1000/night, you expect things to be perfect. First, there seems to be a disconnect between the mainland Westin and Sunset key. Certain things are handled by the mainland, and some are handled by the staff on the island. In one situation, we booked a couples massage and it was completely screwed up. The mainland concierge told us that no second masseuse was available, so my wife decided to get a massage alone. Apparently, the concierge was able to find a second masseuse but forgot to call us back to tell us about this. My wife only found this out when she showed up for the massage. Itâ€™s not like I could just run downstairs and join my wife, given the boat schedule! When I talked to the mainland concierge about the situation (who arranged it), they seemed indifferent and didn't care. The concierge on Sunset Key appeared to care, but only offered me a few hundred Starwood points (which amounts to about $5). A second incident came when I asked the concierge to put rose petals on the bed on my wifeâ€™s birthday. They were able to accommodate me, but they managed to completely blow the surprise for my wife when they called the room about it!!! You have to be kidding!!! Though, to be fair, once they actually did the rose petals, it came out very, very well (candles, rose petals throughout the cottage, etc.) Lastly, and I realize this won't apply to 99% of the people reading this, but I had a box delivered to me for work while staying there. I had proof that FedEx delivered it, but none of the staff could find it for two days. The mainland kept blaming the island, and vice versa. Completely disorganized. I realize most of these sound like nits, but when you stay at a place like this for a special occasion (wife's birthday), and you pay the high rates, you expect certain things. And, when you do bring it to their attention, you expect a sincere response, not a blow off. I notice that the management responds to these reviews on occasion. If the management contacts me through my Tripadvisor account, I will change my review.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property....Service just Okay.”
Reviews.Author: justalady
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying that the property itself is amazing. Great secluded location and wonderful accomodations. We had reserved a 1 bedroom garden view cottage and got a one story locked out unit right next to the pool called "Blue Heron". From the kitchen and the porch, there was a limited but nice view of the ocean. The cottage was great but the service was a little weak. Nothing to get concerned over, just not 5 star service. For example, the kitchen faucet leaked, the floors were never swept or cleaned during our stay, housekeeping didn't leave additional shampoo, conditioner, etc. each day unless you specifically asked, no turn down service (although they do drop off chocolate and water). The pool was perfect. My husband & I were traveling with our 2 year old and loved the 0 degree/ beach style entry on the shallow end. He could play in the pool while we laid out in the sun and watched him. The temperature in the pool was sufficient. The other good thing about the pool was that it seems like it is almost split into 2 sections. In the shallow end, the people with kids gathered. In the deeper end (still only like 4 foot) the adults/couples gathered. It seemed like my kid splashing around and giggling was less of a bother to those who wanted the privacy because of the seperation (maybe they would disagree ha ha). Also, they have float mats for the pool which were very nice too. The service at the pool was also subpar. No towel attendant, no waiter until you go order at the bar and then they'll come out but won't pick up your dishes afterward. Again, not a huge deal, but definately not what would be expected from a nice full service resort. Didn't get to use the beach very much b/c child was afraid of the sand; however, it looked nice and the hammocks were nice to relax on. Boat service to Key West great. Short ride and never seemed like you had to wait very long. Staff was professional and accomodating. Service was great there. Food at pool for lunch was good. Lattitudes for dinner was okay. We got Lobster and filet and they were good but nothing better than anywhere else we ate. It was a slight disappointment. Breakfast basket was great. Overall, wonderful trip. Not sure if I would hurry back to Key West, but if I did, I would definately come back here.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Joeandfamily
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 day stay at Sunset Key Cottages with my wife and 16 yr. old son. We loved it. The cottage we were in (Bahia) was spacious and had wonderful details. Everything was fresh. It was "garden view" but we could still see the ocean. The entire island is nice. Beautiful homes, great flowers and plantings. Service was always with a smile. the convenience to Key West was perfect.A 5 minute boat ride and you are 2 minutes from all the action. Don't miss BO's fish truck for fresh fish sandwiches or the Half Shell raw bar for great fish and oysters. For an elegant dinner try Opera italian right off Duval. Or stay right on the island and go to Latitudes....really good. If you fish, book Luke through the concierge for excellent "back country" or flats fishing. Great vacation all around.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful tropical escape just minutes from Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Mainelobster01
Reviews.Content: The service at Sunset Key was amazing - we were able to just relax and enjoy every minute of our stay...granted it can be a little pricey, we had never spent this much on a vacation before but it was worth it! My only regret is that we didn't stay longer. The island was very peaceful - the tropical landscaping is beautiful and you don't notice the other cottages even though they are pretty close together. It is easy to get back and forth to Key West, although you might never get around to it! You do need a reservation at the Latitudes restaurant, but if you are flexible about times shouldn't be a problem. The restaurant is expensive but no more so than any other nice restaurant, and the food was outstanding! They do room service too in case you are just too lazy to walk the 100 yards or so... Shoes are definitely a must for swimming at the beach - the swimming area was fairly small but no one was swimming when we were there (the water was 70 degreees in Feb, guess that is cold if you are not from Maine!). And the grocery service is great - all of our food was waiting for us in the cabin and it made everything very easy! The concierges are great too and can set up any activities you might want - the vendors will even come to the dock at the island and pick you up! Definitely recommend for a relaxing tropical getaway, whether or not you care to spend time in Key West itself.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: JulesandJakes
Reviews.Content: The main attraction is the location - a private, secluded island with white sand beaches and turquoise waters, but just minutes from Key West. Key West is famous for watching sunsets, but watching the sun set from the pier on Sunset Key is clearly superior. Our cottage was beautiful and the resort itself offered it all - great pool, 2 hot tubs, lush gardens, and superior customer service (just ask for it - they'll get it for you). The only negative reviews I read referred to wear and tear in the cottages. I did notice some, but definitely not enough to take away from our enjoyment of the place. Also, the furniture has an intended "worn" finish, which some may have confused for unwanted wear.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: DelawareSparky
Reviews.Content: Peace, Quiet, and Tranquil A small slice of heaven... I miss my bed there!! Truly like floating on a cloud.. A perfect oasis.. You can enjoy all that Key West and Duval St. have to offer, then come back to the peace of it all at your cottage. We stayed on the corner, Siesta cottage, what a view from every angle.. I really can't say anything bad, it is paradise, 2 bed, 3 full bath, clean, soooo comfortable are the beds, the staff is amazing, It's hard to describe the peace and quietness there, and the boat to the mainland is only a 5 minute ride, always on time, efficient. The breakfast muffins and fruit on your porch are a great touch, too. Yes, it was expensive, but, we got what we paid for!!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean 4.5 star”
Reviews.Author: Phillagirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at sunset key for my 40th Birthday with a few friends. rented at 2 bedroom partial ocean view. Stayed in "sea grapes" cottage. . Plenty of room for 2 couples in the 2 bedroom cottage, 3 bathrooms. They were running a special rate for 2nd night 50% off. The cottages are very cute and clean. Nicely decorated and a nice way to enjoy key west from the quiet of the remote island. It's only a 7 min boat ride from the Mallory square in key west. Staff was nice and friendly. Only down side was that the fitness center was at the westin off of the island at the dock in key west. Made it a bit painfull to schedule a trip to the gym. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Sunset Key and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: nattiepea
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Key West before this trip, but we definitely picked the best place to stay. My husband is more into the nightlife and I like the calm, so this place was perfect. We could jump on the launch and go to the hustle and bustle of Key West or stay and relax in the peace and quiet and beautiful surroundings of Sunset Key. The staff was wonderful. The restaurant on site was very nice and the food was outstanding. The service was perfect. I was actually like a little kid every morning when I went to pick up our breakfast basket from our front porch! What a nice touch! I have absolutely no complaints about Sunset Key! We will be back within the next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Sunset Key- The Best Part of Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: emilyinparis
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four-night stay at Sunset Key. This hotel was truly amazing and it was by far the best thing about our five days in Key West. Our experience would not have been the same if we had stayed somewhere else (and we checked out the competition while we were there including the Westin, the Hyatt, the Casa Marina and Ocean Key) Our cottage (Tradewinds) had a full kitchen, large bedroom with king bed, two bathrooms- one with enormous walk-in shower- and living room with dining area. Every morning, the "breakfast fairy", as we called her, brought a yummy selection of breakfast breads to our porch. We sat in our bathrobes and enjoyed Starbucks coffee while sitting on our "veranda" in the sunshine. The pool and hot tubs were fabulous and we never had any trouble getting our own beach hut on the beach. (We have stayed at other hotels- including the Hyatt Aruba- where you had to wake at 6am and go down to the beach, wait on line to reserve a beach hut!) Latitudes restaurant was wonderful and our waiter was suberb. We never had any trouble catching the boat launch back and forth to Key West and we really enjoyed being away from the craziness of Duvall Street. Our only minor complaint was that we could not get our Ipod to play on the radio in the room. Alltogether, Sunset Key is a heavenly spot. We are excited to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave Sunset Key”
Reviews.Author: Triplalot
Reviews.Content: We could not fault the Guest Cottages or Service that we received on Sunset Key, everything was wonderful. Our garden view cottage (Bahia) had 2 king bedrooms and 3 bathrooms, with a seperate living area/Kitchen. All rooms were well equipped and spotelessly clean with no signs of the "wear and tear"mentioned by previous posts. From the Veranda we had partial sea views in 3 directions which was a nice plus. We liked being so close to Key West, and enjoyed our time during Fantasy Fest, however, it was nice to return to the tranquility of Sunst Key for a good nights sleep. We thought the launch service to and from the island was excellent. The onsite Lattitudes restaurant was excellent and the chef went out of his way to accommodate our veggie daughter. We will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “you pay for the beach and water access”
Reviews.Author: MaryMarg917
Reviews.Content: It was a very lovely property. Beautiful grounds and landscaping. The beach was as nice as it gets in Key West. A little rocky but not too bad. It was great to swim in the ocean, and have a gorgeous ocean view. Our first cottage was a two-bedroom; very nice and clean and a beautiful porch and view. A little raggedy; the upholstered furniture stained and aged. The kitchen appliances dated. Bed ultra-comfortable and bath big and clean with excellent bath products. It was hot as hades, but the ceiling fans on the porch made it very nice to sit outside and enjoy the view and ambience. Our second cottage (we had to move because of flight problems and a lack of vacancy in our first cottage) was a three bedroom that was spacious but dark and very very much in need of a makeover. Carpet stained, furniture stained and the overall impression was that a few years ago this place was nice, but now it is just plain tired. The biggest problem was the uneven service. At over a grand a night, off season, one would expect stellar service. Not to be; room service limited, and very slow, not to mention outrageousy expensive. The food was very good however. Housekeeping late in the day and not up to standards of other 4-5 star properties. The mini-bar guy was a joke. He literally was absent some days. You may think this unimportant but there is nothing to be had on that island after 11pm in terms of alcohol or snacks. They have 24 hour roomservice that the security guy is in charge of!!!!! and the times I tried to reach him, the Westin said that had to page him. But he cannot serve any alcohol and I never heard back. So, if you miss the minibar guy you are essentially without an evening cocktail or beer. We were there 10 days and 5 out of 10 we saw no minibar guy. Apparently he is from the Westin across the water and he is only available a couple of hours a day for Sunset Key. They will say it is because of a "privacy please" sign but that is a blatant lie. The beach guy was very rarely there and provided very little service. I had to go to the beach hut and get towels out of the linen bags that were in the back. Every day. The fact that they charge 25.00 per person for a resort fee should assure that there is good beach service. The pool scene however, was terrific. There was no pool service per se, as far as anyone laying out towels etc. but the pool bar /restaurant was run by two very hard-working nice guys. Jan and Marcus. Stellar service and friendly. Oh, and back to the service; we had lunch at Latitudes our first day there to the tune of almost $200 and our waiter wore a filthy shirt and was obviously bored. Almost like we were an imposition. All in all we had a wonderful time. We are not high maintenance people and love to have a good time. Check out my other reports. However, upon leaving I felt a bit ripped-off.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sunset Key”
Reviews.Author: TexasSoccermom11
Reviews.Content: Beautiful island and excellent accomodations. My husband and I got away for a few days here and absolutely loved it. The service was impeccable. If you want a quiet place to get away this is definitely the place. Once you get off the boat and step onto the island it is paradise. Very quiet. It was a great respite from the hustle and bustle of Key West and Duval St. The only thing they are missing is a spa and I believe they are planning on adding one. The cottage was spacious. We had a one bedroom and it had two bathrooms. The muffins and orange juice every morning were nice. They also bring Fiji water and chocolate every day. We will definitely stay here again as we loved the solitude. Beach is nice but is rocky in the water. Bring aqua socks if you plan on doing much swimming in the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Visit”
Reviews.Author: bostonluke
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending a week at the property. It was one of the most perfect vacations. The service was great and the cottage was great. There were only a few things that could have make the experience perfect. The cottage was a great size. There were five of us and it never felt overly crowded. The kitchen was tiny but we don't cook when we are on vacation anyway. They installed wireless internet in the cottages while we were there which made it nice to not have to be wired to the wall with my laptop. It was great to have a 3rd bathroom. It made showering much easier. There was a nice lcd tv in the living room but the tv signal was pretty lousy. They need to have HD boxes in the cottages at this price point. The only other inconvenience was the electronic lock system on the doors. It took a little while to figure out how to lock the doors correctly and our keys had to be reset a few times during the week. I think part of the problem might have been phones deactivating the keys??? The pool and beach were both great and not too busy which was nice. The Flippers bar was perfect for lunch most days and pretty reasonable priced for a resort. Lattitudes was great for dinner one night. The shuttle boat was fine to get to Key West several times a day. I only missed it once and had to wait a half hour to get off of the island. The only real complaint with the resort is the exercize facility. There is only a workout facility at the Key West hotel so you have to take the shuttle to get to it. Once there, it was a disappointment. It is a small, cramped and overly warm room with very limited equipment. Yes, I want to work out while I'm on vacation and those facilities are important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little island”
Reviews.Author: vsharp
Reviews.Content: Sunset Key is a nice respite from Key West. It is a very nice little island that is very easy to get to and the water taxi runs 24 hours a day. We never had to wait. The cottages were very cute with tin roofs and ours had large verandahs. They were nicely appointed although our second bathroom was small, however, we did have three baths in a two bedroom. Not a big selection on food, but dinner there was wonderful and we also had a couple of extremely good lunches. The staff was nice and the grounds were impeccable. Just one word of warning, there were LOTS of children and only one pool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sunset Cottages!”
Reviews.Author: blue_eyesCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sunset Cottages in the begining of January. From check in to check out the service was excellent. When you check into the Sunset Cottages you have to check in at the Westin on the mainland of Key West. Once check in is complete all of your luggage is sent over on a boat and you don't have to worry about a thing. Once we arrived on the island we were greated by hotel staff that gave us a tour of the property and explained everything in detail. The cottage itself was spacious and beautifully decorated. There was more than enough space for the four of us that stayed in the cottage and we were just steps from the beach. Each morning the hotel provides a complimentary basket filled with fresh fruit and muffins which was a really nice touch. You can also order groceries through the hotel which are priced very reasonably. I recommend doing this as there is only one restaurant at the hotel. Transportation from the island is incredibly convenient, there is a boat that will take you over every fifteen minutes until midnight at which time the boat is on call. When we used the on call method for the boat we did not have to wait more than five minutes. All in all this was a great experience, I would not hesitate to stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip in Key West”
Reviews.Author: miaminj03
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent and a nice getaway from the crowds and rowdiness in the drunken cruisers in Key West. Go into town after the last cruise ship leaves, and you'll have a great experience. The rooms were nice and clean, maybe could use a little updating and the restaurant was great. The service was a little lacking.... not quite up to Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton standards; however I would recommend the hotel nonetheless. See the 10 candid traveller photos I posted.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Creekcrawler
Reviews.Content: Our 6th or 7th time to Sunset Key but first since Westin took over. Very few changes noticed and overll the setting and the cottages are very nice. The cottages could use an overhaul with come new carpets and additinal horizontal surfaces in the bathrooms . Food/drinks at Latitudes continue to be pricey and a bit skimpy . Staff was very professional and accomodating. The island setting 5 minutes from the Key West Marina continues to be the attraction. Will go again but would love for the Westin to spruce up the accomodations a bit .

Reviews.Title: “Nice cottages but overpriced and forced customer service”
Reviews.Author: carlsonb_2000
Reviews.Content: The cottages are extremely nice (2 bedrooms, 3 baths, nice decor, etc.), the shuttle from the Westin Harbor is no problem (they give you a guest card at the Westin you need to show due to Sunset Key being a private island), the food is fantastic, but this resort is all about the money rather than genuine customer service. It seems at these prices everyone would be treated well but the customer service seems very forced and if you don't stay for a full week nobody seems to care about you or listen to you. Even before our stay, I tried to call the resort to use their concierge services but twice got no answer and the phone transferred to the Westin Key West where they were nice but I was told I should contact the concierge at Sunset Key - I wish I could have! Immediately after checking in, the people for turndown service came into the room and were asked to come back 45 minutes later after we had a chance to get settled and had gone to our scheduled dinner. Instead, they showed up about 20 minutes later and let themselves in while we were showering and getting ready for dinner. On the morning of checkout, it was overcast, rainy, and an overall useless day which worked out okay since we got stuck doing work from the cottage that morning. However, when we asked whether late checkout might be available we were told an emphatic No - unless we paid an extra $75 per hour in which case we were welcome to stay without a problem. After being a Starwood Platinum member for the past 4 years (which really doesn't mean anything at this resort despite the Westin name) and paying a $100 resort fee for pool/beach services we never used due to the constant clouds/rain you would think they could at least be more tactful about the late checkout discussion at a resort of this caliber. Either tell me it is absolutely not available or help me out by giving me at least a 1:00 checkout - their response confirmed my overall impression that they cared about my money but not at all about me which is not exactly a pillar of excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: membermay07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequent travelers and have stayed at many luxurious 5 star hotels around the world. Sunset Key ranks up there amongst the best. It is expensive - probably the most expensive hotel on Key West, but it is worth it if you can afford it. We were there in mid September the same weekend that 20,000 bikers descended on Key West for the annual "Poker Run". Bang goes our quiet weekend we thought. However, the island was tranquil. It was their quiet period, but for 2 days we were the only ones at the pool, and the beach never had more than 10 people on it. The waiters came around with free drinks, free fruit kebabs, glasses of ice water etc - nothing was too much trouble for them. The 2 bed villas were fantastic. 3 bathrooms - each different - one with a great shower, one more standard and one with a tub. The only thing that could have improved them would be a jacuzzi tub. Each villa could comfortably sleep a family or party of 6. The contintental breakfast was so-so, but it was nice to wake up to it delivered on your veranda every morning, along with the fresh orange juice stocked in the fridge the night before. We had a partial ocean view (villa "sea grapes") which was one row back from the ocean - looking directly at Key West. We would sit out most nights after staggering home from the Key West restaurants and bars and enjoy a nightcap while looking at the ocean. The launch was running every 30 minutes, which was never a problem. We were only given a safety briefing once - which was when the coastguard were patrolling the waters. This may be why other reviewers were asked for i.d. The launch was air conditioned and very comfortable. We went to Key West 19 years ago, and it has definitely "tamed down" a little since then. I feel KW is getting a little too touristy for my taste (plenty ot T-shirt shops), but if we went again, we would definitely stay at Sunset Key. FYI - if you don't mind wandering off the beaten trail a little - I definitely recomend Santiago's Tapas. Wonderful Sangria, mini lamb chops, yellowfin Ceviche, hummus etc. Best I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your passport”
Reviews.Author: rmcguire
Reviews.Content: We travel every three months, We use higher end hotels for the service and the ease of accomodation to the facilities. This is a beautiful facility. The onsite food is above average. It is located on an island that is reached by a motor launch. It adds a 10 minute ride from the Westin dock at the end of Key West. The motor launch runs regularly. After several days of riding the launch with out any problem, with no questions asked, we returned to the dock for the ride back to the island with a load of shopping bags only to be told by Tim, a three striper whom we had ridden with before, we must provide identification to board the launch. What we were told is that the island is a private island and that even though we had contracted for a $725 a day room (two people with a continental breakfast -hope you like green banannas) on the island, we must submit to the rules of the owner of the island and not the hotel even though the Westin name brand (Starwood) was on the hotel. The contract for the room was with Westin. To the rescue came another boat captain who knew us. Let me note we were never told of this policy at check in and no one at the front desk (they all said they were managers) could show us where we were noticed of this or where it is posted. After 9/11 submitting a identification check for boarding an airplane is one thing. Contracting for a hotel room with the ride to the room being at the whim of insecure property owner is another. If you like rules such as this, then this is the place to stay, otherwise there are other facilities just as nice in Key West for a lot less money. On onother note, Key West tourism is down. They say that they are the most laid back community in Florida. It is a shame the Westin and its management do not follow those thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JSOB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom cottage on Sunset Key in late May. We found the island a wonderful escape from Key West, we only visited one afternoon and decided to relax on the island the rest of the week. With one exception, to have dinner at Sarabeth's (our favorite meal in Key West). The staff was friendly and willing to do whatever you asked. They did not, however, anticipate our needs as well as some other 5 star properties we have visited. The cottage was decorated nicely and perfect for families, each room has its own bathroom. We particularly enjoyed the pool, comfortable chairs and great lunches. The beach was nice as well, but as many have said a bit rocky. We did our swimming at the pool and enjoyed the hammocks and lounge chairs at the beach. We had breakfast and lunches at Latitudes, and was not once disappointed. We enjoyed our stay and would return especially if we went as a family and needed the space of the cottages. We were disappointed in Key West, but can see why many enjoy the nightlife. In fairness, we did not take the time to get off the beaten path, mostly because we didn't want to leave the island.

Reviews.Title: “Best three-day weekend getaway ever”
Reviews.Author: highway_song
Reviews.Content: Forget all of your preconceptions about Key West - this place is five minutes (by ferry) and a world away. You can walk almost the entire island in 15 minutes, and it's worth doing so -- the private homes/conch cottages are lovely. Terrific tropical landscaping throughout -- amazing varieties of palms (foxtails, silver, etc.), bouganvilla, etc. Cottages are spacious and well laid out (we had a two-bedroom, all on one level - the three-bedrooms are up-and-down, so be forwarned if any issues with stairs). Reasonably usable small kitchens, well-stock fridge (prepackaged food - you can order fresh fruit and a few other things delivered to your cottage). Beach is mostly for sunbathing and staring out at turquoise waters, small sailboats, and the occasional parasailer or Seadoo maniac. The restaurant is called Latitudes, and we had almost every meal there -- DO NOT miss the Gorgonzola steak salad with roasted shallot dressing for lunch (tho burgers and grilled chicken aren't bad either). Pool is sensational but lounge chairs can disappear fast (need to start the "15 minutes and you lose your lounger" policy that other high-end places are adopting). Only drawbacks: deep end is barely four feet, and kidney shape means you can't really swim laps. Had chronic key card issues (which staff admits happen a lot). Enjoyed an impromptu sunset party on the pier one night when some young guys hired a steel drummer and brought out some rum and OJ and made everyone their guests. Worth heading back to Key West mainly to see the Audubon home and gardens, the Little White House, and a few other pleasant things. Unless you love Bourbon Street, steer clear of Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Satisfied with Sunset Key”
Reviews.Author: PizzaPie
Reviews.Content: I was going to write a full review but the previous reviewer says it all! The staff, grounds, cottages were all excellent. My husband and I went with another couple and rented a 2 bedroom cottage (our cottage was called Trade Winds). We had a garden view which was wonderful. Each couple had their own "big" bedroom with King size beds. Each bedroom had their own bathroom and plenty of drawer and closet space (also tv's in each room). We were there from May 23-28 and during that time the weather was perfect except for some pretty windy days. Because of the wind we couldn't enjoy the beach like we wanted to so we went to the pool quite often - which was very nice! We also took the water shuttle many times to Key West. The water shuttle operates every 1/2 hour and literally takes no more than 5 minutes from dock to dock. We were not inconvenienced at all and actually enjoyed the ride and the view each time. I also found Key West very similar to New Orleans. Plenty of bars to be found and good restaurants. One restaurant we went to for breakfast twice was the "Blue Angel" - excellent food and the atmosphere was unlike any I've ever been to. When we first went I was a little leary about the place - it's outdoors, under trees and umbrellas, dirt floor with a few chickens and roosters roaming around (you'll see alot of this in KeyWest) but honestly once I had my Mimosa and tried the food I was in heaven. A couple of other restaurants I would recommend would be Island Dogs for lunch, Prime 951 for great steaks, La Trattoria for great Italian. To end - I would highly recommend the Sunset Key Guest Cottages and Key West. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing babymoon on Sunset Key”
Reviews.Author: SweetHomeAL83
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long babymoon to Sunset Key Cottages. After seeing an episode of the Travel Channel's "Great Hotels" that featured Sunset Key, my husband and I decided to give it a try as a special getaway before the birth of our first baby. Sunset Key seemed to fit the bill for the things we wanted. We wanted a unique, private, upscale, quiet place (not some high rise hotel with throngs of people everywhere) with tropical weather, a beach, a great restaurant, a pool for days we didn't want to go to the beach, and we wanted the destination to be on the mainland. Once in Key West, it only took about 5-10 minutes to ride the shuttle boat from the Westin to Sunset Key Island. It's a beautiful ride with friendly crew members. There are only 37 cottages on the island for guests (not including the residences on the island) which made us feel like we were 2 of a small number of guests. It wasn't crowded at all...and we liked that very much. We stayed in cottage 701 (Sanctuary -each cottage has a name) The first night we were there, our bedroom air conditioner conked out. I called the front desk, someone was there in less than 2 minutes and replaced the entire unit. They also opened up the 2nd bedroom of the cottage just in case to make sure I had a cool room to sleep in that night (in case the replacement was faulty)! That means a lot to a woman who is 6 months pregnant, believe me! (We rented a one bedroom - so the other half of the cottage that included the 2nd bedroom was locked and closed off) I was impressed with their promptness and professionalism. I was told twice by the concierge, "We just want you to be satisfied." The next day we got a basket of muffins and pound cake with fruit for breakfast with a newspaper. I liked having that each morning. The fridge was well stocked and there was also a basket of goodies on the dining table to choose from. We liked having the kitchenette, a TV in both the bedroom and the living area, and having an extra bathroom besides just the one off the bedroom to use. I liked being able to fill out a grocery list and have our groceries shopped for by someone before we even arrived. Nice touch! I read negative comments about Sunset Key beach service before but we did not experience anything bad at all. We found the beach employees to be very attentive, we did not have to wait for towels or lounger pads, and we were asked many times if we wanted drinks or food from the restaurant. One bit of advice is to buy Aqua socks or beach shoes (not flip flops) to wade into the ocean. The beach, beginning at the waterâ€™s edge, is very rocky and I saw many people painfully wade in and out wishing they'd bought something to protect their feet! The beach is small but nice......the only thing I wish is that Westin guests were not allowed on the Sunset Key beach. I think Sunset Key guests are paying prices that should give them beach exclusivity. We never used the pool but did drop by to look at it. It was very nice and well landscaped. The one restaurant on the island was wonderful. We ordered room service many times and also ate in the restaurant as well. We found the food to be excellent and got great service with the exception of one rude waiter one night. The rest of the time, the staff couldn't have been any nicer or more friendly. My favorite was the lobster duo and mixed green salad. Yummy! We took the boat shuttle over to Key West several times. We were glad it ran every half hour. Being pregnant, I couldn't participate in Key West bar drinking, but my hubby and I had a great time going to different restaurants and touring. Key West reminded us of a whole city of Bourbon Streets (New Orleans). That's what was great about Sunset Key. You can take the shuttle boat and be involved in all the hub bub of Key West but go back to Sunset Key for peace and quiet. And you can do as much or as little as you like. Other points: I liked the large showers, comfy mattress and fluffy soft bed linens. The robes were wonderful as well. We liked the turn down service - they were always cordial and friendly if we happened to be there. The concierge was always a big help when I called them and have a computer in their office for guests to use to check email. They also have DVD's for guests as well. I liked the gift shop and again experienced friendly service there. We liked coming in every evening to find our dishes washed in the dishwasher including the coffee pot. We also liked having the outside showers by the back porch of our cottage to rinse away beach sand from ourselves and our clothing/shoes before going inside each evening. My husband certainly appreciated the staff checking with him to see if he needed restock of the alcoholic drinks provided in our cottage as well. Only one other maintenance occurrence happened....we had a toilet that wouldn't flush one day and a sink that was clogged. Again, after calling the front desk, someone was there within minutes to fix both things within a 30 minute period. I would recommend Sunset Key to anyone.....my husband and I thought it was such a special place and we came home totally rested and recharged. We loved spending late evenings on our cottage porch in the rocking chairs feeling the ocean breeze blow. I was so sad to leave! We will remember our babymoon at Sunset Key as being a very special one! Feel free to email me if you have other questions I didnâ€™t answer in this review.
